Vacature: Data Analist (Freelance)


Wij zoeken een ervaren Data Analist voor een uitdagende opdracht binnen een organisatie met een sterke maatschappelijke impact. Het team waarin je terechtkomt is verantwoordelijk voor het leveren van rapporten en dashboards waarmee het management en diverse teams inzichten verkrijgen om prestaties te monitoren en problemen vroegtijdig te signaleren. Daarnaast lever je data aan voor strategische beslissingen en ondersteun je AI-initiatieven door relevante datasets beschikbaar te stellen.


Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

  • Ontwikkelen en verbeteren van interactieve dashboards en rapportages.
  • Analyseren van complexe datasets om trends en inzichten te ontdekken.
  • Aanspreekpunt zijn voor de business binnen een functioneel domein.
  • Co√∂rdineren van werkzaamheden binnen een team van ¬±5 personen.
  • Vertalen van business requirements naar technische analyses en documentatie.
  • Ondersteunen van strategische besluitvorming door middel van datagedreven advies.
  • Samenwerken met agile teams en bijdragen aan sprintplanning, story refinement en backlogbeheer.


Gevraagd profiel


Essentieel:

  • Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een vergelijkbare rol.
  • Sterke kennis van SQL (zelfstandig queries schrijven).
  • Ervaring met het opstellen van dashboards en rapportages (bijvoorbeeld met MicroStrategy, OBI of vergelijkbare BI-tools).
  • Begrip van data-analyse-architecturen (ETL, data warehouses, event-driven systemen).
  • Ervaring met data modelleren (3NF, data vault, dimensioneel).
  • Kennis van Agile en Scrum (story point estimatie, backlog, refinement).
  • Ervaring met Jira en Confluence.
  • Analytisch sterk, probleemoplossend vermogen en goede communicatieskills.
  • Vloeiend in Nederlands, met een goede beheersing van Engels.


Gewenst:

  • Ervaring met unstructured data en grote datavolumes.
  • Kennis van data virtualisatietools en event-driven architectuur.
  • Basiskennis van Python (code kunnen lezen).
  • Ervaring met SAS (Enterprise Guide), Kafka en Apache NiFi.
  • Kennis van ODI (Oracle Data Integrator) is een plus.
  • Ervaring in de rol van Product Owner binnen een agile team.
  • Inzicht in trends en evoluties binnen data-analyse.


Pluspunten:

  • Kennis van de arbeidsmarktcontext is een troef.
  • Ervaring in een adviserende rol naar management en stakeholders.
  • Hands-on ervaring met AI-initiatieven en data-ondersteuning.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een langdurig freelance project met maatschappelijke impact.
  • Samenwerking met een professioneel, multidisciplinair team.
  • Een omgeving waarin innovatie en data centraal staan.
  • Mogelijkheid tot hybride werken (deels onsite, deels remote).


Interesse?

Stuur je CV en een korte motivatie. We nemen snel contact met je op.

4261416278,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/remote-online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4261416278?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=3WBiRMxcPEP8ed%2BJXxeGbA%3D%3D,Remote: Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,Belgium,"Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & Dutch language
Being a resident in Belgium for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Belgium
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

You may also confirm your interest and send your CV directly via email to mailyn.esguerra@telusdigital.com with the subject line: Application for [Job Title] ‚Äì LinkedIn, to ensure your application is promptly received and reviewed.

4263210720,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-quality-analyst-at-laco-4263210720?position=39&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=rgVSBCG5ZO%2FsPItd38Q%2F8w%3D%3D,Data Quality Analyst,LACO,"Flemish Region, Belgium","Unleash your data quality enthusiasm!

Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Quality Analyst, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.
As a Data Quality Analyst, you‚Äôll support our clients with their data quality needs:
Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.
You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent experience.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
You know all about the SQL.
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.
Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you‚Äôll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, ‚Ä¶

So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.

Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our recruiters and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Unleash your data quality enthusiasm!


Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Quality Analyst, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.


YOUR JOB

As a Data Quality Analyst, you‚Äôll support our clients with their data quality needs:


  • Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
  • Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
  • Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
  • Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
  • Build data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
  • Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
  • Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
  • Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.

  • You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
  • You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
  • You have proven experience with data quality projects.

4273576137,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-prosana-4273576137?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ZilAJrA2nfy4mVtnl8WhxQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Prosana,European Economic Area,"Tired of inheriting someone else‚Äôs messy dashboards? Ready to build the entire BI function from the ground up - your way?

We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on Data Analyst to help a fast-scaling eCommerce team stop guessing and start acting on real data. This is a unique opportunity to architect a clean, scalable data infrastructure from scratch, enabling data-driven decisions across marketing, ops, product, and leadership.

If you love collecting, cleaning, and connecting data - and transforming that into insights that actually drive action - this is your chance to make a massive impact in a company that‚Äôs hungry for your expertise.

To build and own a brand-new Business Intelligence system, structuring raw, fragmented data from multiple sources into accessible dashboards and reports that empower the teams to optimize performance, identify inefficiencies, and make smarter decisions.
This is a full-time, contractor role.
Architect the company‚Äôs entire BI stack and define best practices from day one
Work with high-leverage datasets from platforms like Shopify, Meta Ads, GA, TripleWhale, Klaviyo, and more
Operate independently in a low-data-maturity environment where your work will directly drive growth
Work from anywhere with a fully international and global team
Build a brand-new Business Intelligence infrastructure from scratch - no legacy systems to fight against
Collect and connect data from multiple marketing and analytics platforms to create a unified view of performance
Build and maintain automated processes that transform raw data into structured, usable insights
Design intuitive dashboards and reports that help the team make fast, informed decisions

Tired of inheriting someone else‚Äôs messy dashboards? Ready to build the entire BI function from the ground up - your way?


We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on Data Analyst to help a fast-scaling eCommerce team stop guessing and start acting on real data. This is a unique opportunity to architect a clean, scalable data infrastructure from scratch, enabling data-driven decisions across marketing, ops, product, and leadership.


If you love collecting, cleaning, and connecting data - and transforming that into insights that actually drive action - this is your chance to make a massive impact in a company that‚Äôs hungry for your expertise.


YOUR MISSION

To build and own a brand-new Business Intelligence system, structuring raw, fragmented data from multiple sources into accessible dashboards and reports that empower the teams to optimize performance, identify inefficiencies, and make smarter decisions.

This is a full-time, contractor role.


WHAT‚ÄôS IN IT FOR YOU

  • Architect the company‚Äôs entire BI stack and define best practices from day one
  • Work with high-leverage datasets from platforms like Shopify, Meta Ads, GA, TripleWhale, Klaviyo, and more
  • Operate independently in a low-data-maturity environment where your work will directly drive growth
  • Work from anywhere with a fully international and global team


WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL BE DOING

  • Build a brand-new Business Intelligence infrastructure from scratch - no legacy systems to fight against
  • Collect and connect data from multiple marketing and analytics platforms to create a unified view of performance
  • Build and maintain automated processes that transform raw data into structured, usable insights
  • Design intuitive dashboards and reports that help the team make fast, informed decisions
  • Turn complex data into clear, actionable insights that drive marketing strategy and funnel performance
  • Spot anomalies or underperformance early and flag them to key stakeholders

4277210340,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-consultant-energy-department-at-capco-4277210340?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=R4bL9eIjD4hhQGB3Bydhyw%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Consultant (Energy Department),Capco,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data consultant
Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?
Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?
Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.
We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.
In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.
You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.
Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.
We Are Looking For Talent With The Following
Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis
Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English
The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals

An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers

Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients

Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following

  • Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
  • Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
  • Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
  • Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
  • Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
  • Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
  • Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis

Skills &
column2:
Expertise

  • Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the energy industry (or financial / banking) or a consultancy firm
  • Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
  • Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
  • Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
  • You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
  • Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English

What We Offer You

  • The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
  • An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
  • Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
  • A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
  • A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
  • A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
  • A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

4276026752,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-analyst-at-engie-belgium-4276026752?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=dIyT5dMsM%2Ffjurj%2FvkAV2Q%3D%3D,Quantitative Analyst,ENGIE Belgium,"Uccle, Brussels Region, Belgium","Quantitative analyst

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 100,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress

BU Supply & Energy Management provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients (businesses and retail) through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

15000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through international business platforms and B2C entities. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors, industrials and retail. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At S&EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 115 quantitative analysts. It‚Äôs mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS and to Engie worldwide. The quantitative analyst will be part of the ‚ÄúPricing‚Äù team (approximately 15 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading & Commercial.
The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:

Work very closely with the BP Power Trading & Commercial, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, ‚Ä¶).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.
Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, ‚Ä¶)
Coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
0 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.
Travels: Occasional travels (for example conferences) are possible, but limited.
If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!
Apply by attaching your updated CV.

Divisie: GEMS - EC QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH & MODELING
Juridische entiteit: ENGIE GLOBAL MARKETS, BELGIAN BRANCH

Quantitative analyst

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 100,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress

About S&
column2:
EM:

BU Supply &
column3:
Energy Management provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients (businesses and retail) through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

15000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through international business platforms and B2C entities. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas &
column4:
LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors, industrials and retail. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

At S&
column5:
EM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 115 quantitative analysts. It‚Äôs mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS and to Engie worldwide. The quantitative analyst will be part of the ‚ÄúPricing‚Äù team (approximately 15 people) and will be fully dedicated to the Business Platform Power Trading &
column6:
Commercial.

Role:

The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:

  • Work very closely with the BP Power Trading &
column7:
Commercial, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading team and the Asset Backed Power Trading team. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
  • Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
  • Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
  • Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, ‚Ä¶).
  • Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
  • Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.

    • Hard skills:

    • Must have:
      • Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, ‚Ä¶)
      • Coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
      • Familiar with Git


    • Good to have:
      • Experience on the power markets
      • Experience on different optimization methods
      • Experience in a trading environment
    Soft skills:

    • Must have:
      • Practical and conceptual thinking
      • Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
      • Ability to deliver concrete solutions
      • Autonomy
      • Working together
    Ed ucation and professional background:

    • Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
    • 0 to 3 years of experience in a similar role.

    Languages:

    • English

    Travels: Occasional travels (for example conferences) are possible, but limited.

    If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

From our roots in database management to our evolving focus on data governance and architecture, we‚Äôve built a reputation for delivering solutions tailored to each client‚Äôs unique needs. As a family-owned business, we value collaboration and personal growth, fostering a close-knit environment where everyone‚Äôs contributions truly matter. Our main office is located in Holsbeek, and we work with clients all over Belgium.

We‚Äôre looking for a Power BI Consultant to support a client in the Brussels area. In this role, you will design and build compelling dashboards and reports that bring insights to life. You‚Äôll work in a hybrid environment with both business and technical teams to deliver sustainable BI solutions that drive value.
Design interactive Power BI dashboards tailored to business needs
Translate complex data into clear visuals and insights
Integrate diverse data sources to create unified reporting views
Ensure performance optimization and data reliability
Collaborate across teams to ensure alignment on data and reporting requirements
Strong Power BI experience (5+ years developing dashboards and reports)
Fluent in DAX, M & SQL for data transformation and calculations
Analytical mindset with a sharp eye for clean, intuitive visualizations
Effective communicator with both technical and business teams
Proficiency in English and Dutch or French
Family Feel: We organize at least four team events each year, plus an annual weekend getaway where partners are welcome.
Flexible & Hybrid Work: While some client-facing time may be required, we promote a healthy mix of remote and on-site collaboration.
Impactful Projects: Contribute to data initiatives for reputable clients where your expertise drives tangible results.
Competitive Package: Enjoy market-aligned compensation, plus opportunities for professional development.

Infocura is more than a workplace, it‚Äôs a community of seasoned data experts known for solving the toughest challenges. With a strong foundation in data management and deep technical expertise, we help organizations design, integrate, and optimize their data ecosystems. Our work spans everything from database management to advanced data architecture and governance, ensuring clients get the right solutions for their needs.
If you're looking to work alongside top experts and make a real impact, Infocura is the place to be.
Excited to turn data into decisions with powerful dashboards? Apply via LinkedIn or send your CV to jens.miseur@infocura.be.

4261039300,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analytics-lead-at-huspy-4261039300?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=C97ezwTgteY7byx83OZYwQ%3D%3D,Data Analytics Lead,Huspy,European Economic Area,"The Story so far: Who we are

Founded in August 2020, Huspy started as a digital mortgage platform and quickly evolved into the largest proptech company in the EMEA region. Fast forward to today, we have over 500+ employees across 5+ offices in UAE and Spain. Backed by leading investors such as Sequoia, Balderton, Founders Fund, and Olayan, our mission is to revolutionize the real estate industry by building an all-in-one super app designed to empower agents and mortgage brokers.
The Main Event: What you'll do

We‚Äôre hiring a Data Analytics Lead to manage our analytics function and shape how Huspy uses data to drive decisions. This role sits at the intersection of strategy, product, and growth‚Äîsupporting key company bets across business units and countries.

You‚Äôll work closely with C-level, product, and tech leadership to establish a top-tier data function, scale the analytics team, and build the infrastructure, reporting, and processes that power Huspy‚Äôs next phase of growth.
Partner with C-level and business/product leads to shape strategy through data
Develop the infrastructure, tools, and reporting frameworks to enable company-wide data access and transparency
Support business expansion and product initiatives with actionable insights, modeling, and forecasting
Establish and maintain KPIs across business units to track performance and identify opportunities
Enable self-serve analytics and promote a culture of data-driven decision-making across teams
The Perfect Match: What you bring
6‚Äì8 years of experience in data analytics, with 1‚Äì2 years leading people
Proven experience in fast-paced, data-driven environments (tech, marketplaces preferred)
Ability to work cross-functionally and communicate clearly with technical and non-technical teams
Experience building data processes and reporting infrastructure from scratch
Strong commercial acumen and ability to connect data with business value

4269638400,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/product-data-analyst-at-phrase-4269638400?position=53&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=MZFGPmwZLa2WSGm9mozeMw%3D%3D,Product Data Analyst,Phrase,European Economic Area,"At Phrase, we help open the door to global business by providing the world‚Äôs most comprehensive localization platform.

We‚Äôre transforming language technology with our AI platform to give people the content they need, in the language they speak. Whether it's for digital products like an app or website, marketing comms, legal literature, internal comms or customer service messaging, Phrase ensures that content always hits its mark by being on brand, consistent, and culturally resonant.

With a global team working from our offices in Hamburg and Prague‚Äîor from home across Europe, the UK, the US, and the APAC region‚Äîwe help organizations like Uber, Shopify, Puma, Snowflake, Volkswagen and thousands of others engage their customers at scale to accelerate growth.

As a Product Data Analyst at Phrase, you will play a pivotal role in guiding product prioritization through data-driven insights. You will collaborate closely with Product Managers to implement analytics functionalities that empower our customers to make informed decisions. You will influence the development of data products for customers, participate in strategic discussions, respond to input from our customers to address their needs.Your work will be instrumental in bringing our Product vision to life and driving the success of Phrase's innovative localization solutions.
Collaborate with Product Managers to identify data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Develop and implement analytics functionalities within the Control Hub domain to support data-driven decision-making for customers.
Conduct detailed statistical analyses and data visualizations to inform product strategy and prioritization.
Manage competing priorities while navigating a high-context-switching environment.
Collaborate with customers to understand their data needs and gather feedback to help improve the product continuously.
Work closely with the BI/Data team and other stakeholders to ensure data integrity and optimize analytics solutions.
Influence strategic decision-making by providing evidence-based insights and recommendations.
Proven experience in analytical thinking and problem-solving within a product-oriented environment.
Proficiency in data visualization, statistical analysis, and SQL.
Hands-on experience with data tools and platforms commonly used for product analytics.
Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to manage competing priorities effectively.
A strategic mindset with a basic understanding of product management principles.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to influence stakeholders across teams.
Experience in customer-facing roles or participating in customer calls is a plus.
Work experience in a successful and growing global SaaS company
Be part of an international team of 300+ in Europe, APAC, and the Americas
Expert colleagues in their field who are determined to build the best localization platform on the market, creating a world where language never limits opportunity
An agile work environment, where it is encouraged to take smart risks
Take part in a culture full of trust, support and loyalty, where respectful and open feedback is valued, and diversity is fully embraced
A positive, open-minded, and innovative atmosphere
Support in your professional development and personal career goals
4 Company holidays additional to your regular holidays (1 day per quarter where the entire company is off to celebrate our achievements).
In addition, the company also provides employees with a Christmas break to allow you to spend time with family and friends without use of your vacation allocation.
Your birthday is off because it is important to celebrate you as well.
2 Giveback days where you can support the local community, volunteer, and/or participate in charity events and activities.
Learning & development through Phrase learning and a dedicated ChatGPT Plus user license
Additional local benefits depending on the entity you're hired at, just ask your Talent Acquisition Partner

4260395723,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-projective-talent-part-of-projective-group-4260395723?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ifgeqBsMH%2Fhc3qI8Qie0jg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Projective Talent | Part of Projective Group,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Ben jij analytisch sterk en gedreven om inzichten uit data te halen die √©cht het verschil maken? Werk je graag met verschillende datasets, tools en stakeholders om waardevolle analyses op te leveren? Dan ben jij misschien de Data Analyst die we zoeken om ons team te versterken!

Onze organisatie investeert volop in data en digitale transformatie. Binnen het Data & IT-team werk je mee aan het ontwikkelen van een betrouwbaar en bruikbaar dataplatform dat inspeelt op zowel operationele als strategische behoeften. We zoeken iemand die niet alleen data begrijpt, maar ook weet hoe je die vertaalt naar bruikbare inzichten voor de business.
Je analyseert datasets en haalt er trends, verbanden en inzichten uit die bijdragen aan onderbouwde besluitvorming
Je bespreekt vragen en noden met stakeholders en vertaalt die naar gerichte data-analyses en dashboards
Je werkt mee aan het verbeteren van de datakwaliteit en -structuur
Je ondersteunt gebruikers bij het interpreteren van analyses en het inzetten van inzichten in de praktijk
Je denkt actief mee over hoe data slimmer gebruikt kan worden binnen de organisatie
We zoeken geen allesweter, maar wel iemand met een nieuwsgierige geest en een sterke interesse in data. Bij ons krijg je ruimte om te groeien, te leren en jezelf verder te ontwikkelen.
Een bachelor- of masterdiploma in een analytische richting zoals (Toegepaste) Economie, Informatica, Statistiek, Wiskunde, Engineering of gelijkaardig
Ervaring of interesse in tools zoals SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau of Python/R
Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe informatie helder over te brengen
Een teamgerichte instelling en de flexibiliteit om samen te werken met verschillende afdelingen
Vlotte kennis van Nederlands of Frans, en een goede beheersing van het Engels
Dit mag je van ons verwachten:

Een aantrekkelijk salaris en een flexibel mobiliteitsbudget (inclusief de keuze voor een bedrijfswagen of fietsleasing). Daarnaast ontvang je ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget √©n verschillende bonussen opportuniteiten - want we vinden dat goed werk beloond mag worden.
Je stapt in een van onze Smart Programmes, afgestemd op waar jij staat in je carri√®re en waar je naartoe wil groeien.
Gebaseerd op jouw skills, ambitie en persoonlijkheid zoeken we samen naar de juiste match bij een van onze klanten.
Tijdens het hele traject word je begeleid door je persoonlijke Talent Development Officer, iemand die er echt is om jou te helpen groeien.
Je staat er nooit alleen voor. Reken op regelmatige training sessies, fun events en een hechte community die altijd achter je staat.
Na twee jaar vol ontwikkeling, coaching en impact krijg je de kans om bij je klant in dienst te treden. Je blijft uiteraard altijd welkom op onze alumni-events.

Ben jij analytisch sterk en gedreven om inzichten uit data te halen die √©cht het verschil maken? Werk je graag met verschillende datasets, tools en stakeholders om waardevolle analyses op te leveren? Dan ben jij misschien de Data Analyst die we zoeken om ons team te versterken!


Onze organisatie investeert volop in data en digitale transformatie. Binnen het Data &
column2:
IT-team werk je mee aan het ontwikkelen van een betrouwbaar en bruikbaar dataplatform dat inspeelt op zowel operationele als strategische behoeften. We zoeken iemand die niet alleen data begrijpt, maar ook weet hoe je die vertaalt naar bruikbare inzichten voor de business.


Wat ga je doen?


  • Je analyseert datasets en haalt er trends, verbanden en inzichten uit die bijdragen aan onderbouwde besluitvorming
  • Je bespreekt vragen en noden met stakeholders en vertaalt die naar gerichte data-analyses en dashboards
  • Je werkt mee aan het verbeteren van de datakwaliteit en -structuur
  • Je ondersteunt gebruikers bij het interpreteren van analyses en het inzetten van inzichten in de praktijk
  • Je denkt actief mee over hoe data slimmer gebruikt kan worden binnen de organisatie


Wat breng jij mee?


We zoeken geen allesweter, maar wel iemand met een nieuwsgierige geest en een sterke interesse in data. Bij ons krijg je ruimte om te groeien, te leren en jezelf verder te ontwikkelen.


Jij beschikt idealiter over:


  • Een bachelor- of masterdiploma in een analytische richting zoals (Toegepaste) Economie, Informatica, Statistiek, Wiskunde, Engineering of gelijkaardig
  • Ervaring of interesse in tools zoals SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau of Python/R
  • Goede communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe informatie helder over te brengen
  • Een teamgerichte instelling en de flexibiliteit om samen te werken met verschillende afdelingen
  • Vlotte kennis van Nederlands of Frans, en een goede beheersing van het Engels


Dit mag je van ons verwachten:


  • Een aantrekkelijk salaris en een flexibel mobiliteitsbudget (inclusief de keuze voor een bedrijfswagen of fietsleasing). Daarnaast ontvang je ook maaltijd- en ecocheques, een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget √©n verschillende bonussen opportuniteiten - want we vinden dat goed werk beloond mag worden.
  • Je stapt in een van onze Smart Programmes, afgestemd op waar jij staat in je carri√®re en waar je naartoe wil groeien.
  • Gebaseerd op jouw skills, ambitie en persoonlijkheid zoeken we samen naar de juiste match bij een van onze klanten.
  • Tijdens het hele traject word je begeleid door je persoonlijke Talent Development Officer, iemand die er echt is om jou te helpen groeien.
  • Je staat er nooit alleen voor. Reken op regelmatige training sessies, fun events en een hechte community die altijd achter je staat.
  • Na twee jaar vol ontwikkeling, coaching en impact krijg je de kans om bij je klant in dienst te treden. Je blijft uiteraard altijd welkom op onze alumni-events.

4277847452,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/statistical-analyst-at-eortc-european-organisation-for-research-and-treatment-of-cancer-4277847452?position=56&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=9BweZp9TmTtGoTeiPwUW5w%3D%3D,Statistical Analyst,EORTC - European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","The Statistical Analyst works under the hierarchical supervision of the Head of Statistics Department.

Statistical Analysts are experts in SAS and other statistical programming language and support the activities of the EORTC Statistics Department. The Statistical Analyst complies with the EORTC standard operating procedures and other international guidelines in use at EORTC. The main responsibilities include
Development and validation of SAS programs for the reporting of clinical trials according to defined statistical analysis plans
Developing and Implementing Data Cleaning Programs
Development and validation of standard SAS programs and SAS macros

As member of the statistics department, the statistical analyst is actively participating in the scientific activities of the department. The statistical analyst is also offered the possibility to increase her/his knowledge of the medical field and statistical methodology through attendance to training courses and conferences organized by EORTC and select external training relevant to his/her activities.
A Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience of programming and reporting of clinical trial data
Excellent knowledge of SAS (SAS BASE, SAS STAT, SAS GRAPH, SAS MACRO, SAS ODS), knowledge of R is a plus
Knowledge of CDISC/ADAM STDM standards is a plus
Be able to work in an international and multidisciplinary environment
Dynamic and capable of working autonomously inside a team

The Statistical Analyst works under the hierarchical supervision of the Head of Statistics Department.

Main responsibilities / Major Activities

Statistical Analysts are experts in SAS and other statistical programming language and support the activities of the EORTC Statistics Department. The Statistical Analyst complies with the EORTC standard operating procedures and other international guidelines in use at EORTC. The main responsibilities include

  • Development and validation of SAS programs for the reporting of clinical trials according to defined statistical analysis plans
  • Production of intermediate study reports
  • Data exchanges with external partners
  • Database reconciliation
  • Developing and Implementing Data Cleaning Programs
  • Quality control of SAS programs
  • Development and validation of standard SAS programs and SAS macros
  • Trial results disclosure (EudraCT/ClinicalTrials.gov reporting)

As member of the statistics department, the statistical analyst is actively participating in the scientific activities of the department. The statistical analyst is also offered the possibility to increase her/his knowledge of the medical field and statistical methodology through attendance to training courses and conferences organized by EORTC and select external training relevant to his/her activities.

Profile

  • A Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Experience of programming and reporting of clinical trial data
  • Excellent knowledge of SAS (SAS BASE, SAS STAT, SAS GRAPH, SAS MACRO, SAS ODS), knowledge of R is a plus
  • Knowledge of CDISC/ADAM STDM standards is a plus
  • Be able to work in an international and multidisciplinary environment
  • Fluent in English (oral and written)
  • Dynamic and capable of working autonomously inside a team

Kontich | Internationale werkomgeving | Fulltime (40u/week) | Hybride werken mogelijk

Ben jij gebeten door data en klaar om je BI-skills in te zetten in een snelgroeiende organisatie die bouwt aan de infrastructuur van morgen? In deze functie werk je mee aan slimme rapportering en diepgaande analyses die businessbeslissingen rechtstreeks be√Ønvloeden. Deze sterk groeiende speler is actief in de uitrol, modernisering en ondersteuning digitale infrastructuur in Belgi√´. Met meer dan 1.000 medewerkers in de Benelux en een geschatte jaaromzet van meer dan ‚Ç¨200 miljoen, levert de organisatie cruciale diensten voor verschillende bedrijven en diensten.
Je komt terecht in een hecht team waar je ownership krijgt over je werk, maar ook omringd wordt door collega‚Äôs met kennis van zaken. Variatie, vrijheid en impact gegarandeerd.
Ontwikkelen en beheren van dashboards, analyses en rapporteringen in Power BI
Bouwen aan een centrale dataroom en integraties realiseren met andere systemen
Vertalen van businessdoelstellingen naar KPI‚Äôs en procesverbeteringen op basis van data

Minstens 4 jaar ervaring in een BI- of data-analysefunctie
Grondige kennis van Power BI, DAX, M Query, datamodellering en ETL-processen
Ervaring met Python en Notebooks is een plus
Sterke analytische vaardigheden en gestructureerde projectaanpak
Zeer goede kennis van Nederlands en Engels

Data Analist ‚Äì Breng data tot leven en maak impact


Kontich | Internationale werkomgeving | Fulltime (40u/week) | Hybride werken mogelijk


Ben jij gebeten door data en klaar om je BI-skills in te zetten in een snelgroeiende organisatie die bouwt aan de infrastructuur van morgen? In deze functie werk je mee aan slimme rapportering en diepgaande analyses die businessbeslissingen rechtstreeks be√Ønvloeden. Je krijgt de ruimte om zelfstandig projecten uit te bouwen en je expertise verder te verdiepen met de nieuwste technologie√´n.


Deze sterk groeiende speler is actief in de uitrol, modernisering en ondersteuning digitale infrastructuur in Belgi√´. Met meer dan 1.000 medewerkers in de Benelux en een geschatte jaaromzet van meer dan ‚Ç¨200 miljoen, levert de organisatie cruciale diensten voor verschillende bedrijven en diensten.


Je komt terecht in een hecht team waar je ownership krijgt over je werk, maar ook omringd wordt door collega‚Äôs met kennis van zaken. Variatie, vrijheid en impact gegarandeerd.


Data Analist - Jouw verantwoordelijkheden


  • Ontwikkelen en beheren van dashboards, analyses en rapporteringen in Power BI
  • Bouwen aan een centrale dataroom en integraties realiseren met andere systemen
  • Vertalen van businessdoelstellingen naar KPI‚Äôs en procesverbeteringen op basis van data
  • Zelfstandig beheren van BI-projecten met ondersteuning van een ervaren team
  • Waken over datakwaliteit en voorzien van betrouwbare inzichten voor de organisatie


Data Analist - Jouw profiel


  • Minstens 4 jaar ervaring in een BI- of data-analysefunctie
  • Grondige kennis van Power BI, DAX, M Query, datamodellering en ETL-processen
  • Ervaring met Python en Notebooks is een plus
  • Sterke analytische vaardigheden en gestructureerde projectaanpak
  • Zeer goede kennis van Nederlands en Engels

Frans is een troef

  • Een voltijdse functie binnen een innovatieve en dynamische organisatie
  • Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met onder andere:
  • Bedrijfswagen met tankkaart
  • Maaltijdcheques, groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering

Het transformeert data naar analytische inzichten die het management ondersteunen bij het nemen van strategische beslissingen, het sturen van de activiteiten van diverse diensten en het optimaliseren van commerci√´le activiteiten.

Als ervaren data-expert ben jij bekwaam in alle facetten van het Data Analyst-vak. Dit omvat een diepgaand begrip van zakelijke vereisten, het verstandig gebruik van beschikbare gegevens en uiteindelijk het leveren van een op maat gemaakte oplossing die naadloos aansluit op specifieke behoeften.
Afhankelijk van de toegewezen projecten, kunnen uw taken verschillende van de volgende punten omvatten:
Analyse van behoeften en formulering van bedrijfsbehoeften:
Grondig begrijpen en defini√´ren van gebruikersbehoeften.
Actief deelnemen aan het formuleren van de vereisten van de bedrijfsteams.
Bijdragen aan het opstellen van functionele specificities.
Ontwikkelen van strategische en operationele aanbevelingen op basis van grondige analyses.
Belangrijke rol vervullen bij het optimaliseren en monitoren van CRM-campagnes.
Analyseren van feedback en voorstellen doen voor verbeteringen om de effectiviteit ervan te maximaliseren.
Analyse van rentabiliteit en ontwerp van relevante indicatoren:
Grondige evaluatie van de rentabiliteit van bankproducten en -diensten.
Ontwikkelen van relevante indicatoren om besluitvorming te ondersteunen.
Data-visualisatie en valorisatie van gegevens door statistische technieken:
Behoeften van bedrijven omzetten in visuele oplossingen.
Gebruik van statistische technieken om informatie uit gegevens te halen.
Strategische leadselectie en grondige kwalificatie van tools:
Toepassen van strikte criteria en modellen voor het selecteren van leidende kandidaten.
Nauwlettend monitoren van de technische en functionele kwalificaties van tools.
Cre√´ren van op maat gemaakte rapporten en monitoringtools.
Heldere en beknopte presentatie van analyses en gebruikerstraining:
Professioneel presenteren van analyses en aanbevelingen.
Een cruciale rol vervullen in het trainen van gebruikers in besluitvormingshulpmiddelen.

Een dynamische functie waarin je snel kunt groeien en veel kunt leren

4269588941,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/power-bi-analyst-at-international-achievers-group-4269588941?position=60&pageNum=0&refId=uQuVA0xrZhhYTZWq3emsEQ%3D%3D&trackingId=02bf3hMFwsqbNGhEpj3xCw%3D%3D,Power BI - Analyst,International Achievers Group,European Union,"Thank you for your application. We are fortunate to receive thousands of applications for our open positions from many highly capable individuals. Each application is carefully reviewed. If your qualifications match the role's requirements, we will be in touch.

If your application is not a strong enough match, we may not be able to respond due to the high volume of submissions. We kindly ask that you refrain from reaching out separately regarding your application if you do not hear from us. We wish you the very best in your job search.

Our client is a global provider of localization, translation, and content services, this company helps businesses adapt their products, services, and content for international markets. Their offerings include translation, software localization, transcreation, multimedia services, and content management. With a focus on quality, innovation, and customer collaboration, they support brands in delivering impactful, culturally relevant experiences to a global audience.
Remote / Spain, Italy, Poland / Working Hours: 9:00am - 5:30pm Irish Time

Summary: We are seeking a talented and motivated Power BI Analyst to join our strategic programs group. The primary responsibility of this role is to create and continuously improve core reports and metrics that support our strategic programs. You will utilize Power BI to build interactive and visually appealing dashboards and reports. This includes gathering report requirements from business teams and building and maintaining complex SQL queries to extract business data from financial reporting systems. Additionally, this role involves coordinating with business teams to understand the drivers of Localization business and communicating these insights to our operations team. A significant part of this role will focus on data analysis to uncover actionable insights and support decision-making processes.
Collaborate with the team to build robust operational and business metrics.
Work with cross-functional teams to design, build, and deploy reporting systems, utilizing metrics effectively.
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
Develop and maintain complex SQL queries to gather and analyze business data from financial reporting systems.
Ensure meticulous project planning and execution with a high level of quality.
Adhere to our quality framework to create error-free, highly reliable processes.
Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable metrics.
Collaborate with the finance team on improvements and creation of financial reporting data.
Present data analysis findings in a clear and visually appealing manner using Power BI.
Minimum of 2 years of experience working with Power BI, creating interactive reports against large datasets.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Proven experience in conducting data analysis and deriving actionable insights.
Ability and interest in working in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
Strong interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication skills.
Experience in the design, creation, management, and business use of large volume datasets.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Creative thinking and adaptability in an evolving environment.
Experience working within a multicultural environment.
Knowledge of quality certifications such as ISO is preferred.
Ability to extract meaningful business insights from complex and unstructured data and present them in an aesthetically appealing manner.
Degree in Analytics or a related field.
Strong experience with Power BI, advanced Excel, and SQL.
Proven skills in data modeling and fundamental statistical knowledge
Familiarity with Google Apps (Google Sheets, Google Docs, Google Slides).
PL-300 Power BI Certification is a plus

Thank you for your application. We are fortunate to receive thousands of applications for our open positions from many highly capable individuals. Each application is carefully reviewed. If your qualifications match the role's requirements, we will be in touch.

If your application is not a strong enough match, we may not be able to respond due to the high volume of submissions. We kindly ask that you refrain from reaching out separately regarding your application if you do not hear from us. We wish you the very best in your job search.


Our client is a global provider of localization, translation, and content services, this company helps businesses adapt their products, services, and content for international markets. Their offerings include translation, software localization, transcreation, multimedia services, and content management. With a focus on quality, innovation, and customer collaboration, they support brands in delivering impactful, culturally relevant experiences to a global audience.


Remote / Spain, Italy, Poland / Working Hours: 9:00am - 5:30pm Irish Time


Summary: We are seeking a talented and motivated Power BI Analyst to join our strategic programs group. The primary responsibility of this role is to create and continuously improve core reports and metrics that support our strategic programs. You will utilize Power BI to build interactive and visually appealing dashboards and reports. This includes gathering report requirements from business teams and building and maintaining complex SQL queries to extract business data from financial reporting systems. Additionally, this role involves coordinating with business teams to understand the drivers of Localization business and communicating these insights to our operations team. A significant part of this role will focus on data analysis to uncover actionable insights and support decision-making processes.



Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with the team to build robust operational and business metrics.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to design, build, and deploy reporting systems, utilizing metrics effectively.
  • Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions.
  • Develop and maintain complex SQL queries to gather and analyze business data from financial reporting systems.
  • Ensure meticulous project planning and execution with a high level of quality.
  • Adhere to our quality framework to create error-free, highly reliable processes.
  • Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable metrics.
  • Collaborate with the finance team on improvements and creation of financial reporting data.
  • Present data analysis findings in a clear and visually appealing manner using Power BI.


‚ÄãRequirements:

  • Minimum of 2 years of experience working with Power BI, creating interactive reports against large datasets.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Proven experience in conducting data analysis and deriving actionable insights.
  • Ability and interest in working in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment.
  • Strong interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication skills.
  • Fluent in English.
  • Experience in the design, creation, management, and business use of large volume datasets.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  • Creative thinking and adaptability in an evolving environment.
  • Experience working within a multicultural environment.
  • Knowledge of quality certifications such as ISO is preferred.
  • Ability to extract meaningful business insights from complex and unstructured data and present them in an aesthetically appealing manner.


‚ÄãTechnical Skills Requirements:

  • Degree in Analytics or a related field.
  • Strong experience with Power BI, advanced Excel, and SQL.
  • Proven skills in data modeling and fundamental statistical knowledge
  • Familiarity with Google Apps (Google Sheets, Google Docs, Google Slides).
  • PL-300 Power BI Certification is a plus

Digital Content Consultant,CCS Technologies IT (P) Ltd.,"Kottayam, Kerala, India","About CCS

CCS Technologies has decades of experience delivering technology-driven solutions for their customers. Based out of Kerala, India and with offices in the US and Middle East, we are on a growth path like never before. Working alongside a close-knit team with tremendous exposure to various technologies, this is a place where you will have plenty of opportunities to learn, contribute, and grow!
What you can expect from the job

As a Trainee Digital Content Consultant, you will be under the guidance of our Lead Consultant and have the chance to enhance your skills in creating compelling product catalogs. This position is ideal for individuals with a keen eye for detail and a passion for crafting engaging product descriptions, who are eager to specialize in the field of catalog writing. The following responsibilities will be assigned to you:
Create and analyze data based on information provided

Strong knowledge in language vocabulary and grammar
Basic skills in Adobe Photoshop and InDesign
Basic skills in SEO for websites
Knowledge of ISMS principles and best practices

Founded in 2017, Vismaya Consulting & Management Services (VCMS) is dedicated to supporting individuals and industries in the fields of Quality Health, Safety, and Environment. The company has successfully completed various consultancy projects, IOSH and IA batches, and HSE and warehouse audits. VCMS remains committed to delivering high-quality solutions to enhance safety and environmental standards in various industries.

This full-time on-site role, across Kerala, Chennai, and Bengaluru. The Business Development Manager will be responsible for identifying and pursuing new business opportunities, building relationships with clients, developing and implementing strategic plans to drive growth, and managing accounts. This role will also involve conducting market research, preparing presentations, and negotiating contracts with potential clients.
Strong Business Development, Sales, and Account Management skills
Experience in client relationship management and customer service
Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills
Market research and strategic planning abilities
Knowledge of Quality Health, Safety, and Environment standards is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field
Ability to work independently and effectively within a team
Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets

Golden Ray is a trusted Solar EPC company with 7+ years of experience delivering high-quality rooftop solar systems across Kerala. We're looking for driven Business Developers to take full ownership of the Alappuzha market.

Indian Institute of Information Technology, Kottayam (IIITK) is an Institution of National Importance under Ministry of Education, Government of India and is located in Valavoor, Palai, in the Kottayam District of Kerala.

This is a full-time, on-site role for a Postdoctoral Researcher focused on UAV security. The role is based in Kottayam. The Postdoctoral Researcher will be responsible for conducting advanced research in the area of UAV security, performing data analysis, and contributing to publications. The role also involves laboratory work, teaching, and mentoring students.
Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, or a closely related field, with a research focus on UAV Security, Cybersecurity, or related domains.
Demonstrated proficiency in laboratory skills, experimental design, and prototyping for UAV or wireless systems.
Strong foundation in Cryptography and secure communication protocols.
Proven research experience with publications in reputed journals and conferences.
Prior teaching or mentoring experience at the undergraduate or postgraduate level.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly present research findings.
Strong independent research capabilities and the ability to collaborate effectively within a multidisciplinary team.

Mathew & Jacob, Chartered Accountants is a prominent provider of Accounting & Assurance services. We offer a comprehensive range of financial services tailored to meet various client needs. For more information about our services, please visit our website at www.mathewandjacob.org. Stay connected with us through our Facebook and Instagram pages for updates and contact information.

This is a full-time, on-site role for an Articled Assistant located in Adoor. The Articled Assistant will perform a range of accounting and auditing tasks including preparing financial statements, conducting audits, and assisting in tax planning. Responsibilities also include maintaining accurate financial records, ensuring compliance with various regulations, and providing support for client financial queries.
Knowledge of Accounting Principles and Financial Reporting
Skills in Auditing and Assurance Services
Proficient/Interest in learning about Tax Planning and Compliance
Ability to work independently and as a part of a team
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Qualified the CA Intermediate Examinations (Both Group)
Experience in using accounting software is a plus
As part of your articleship training, you will gain comprehensive practical exposure in the following core areas:
* Preparation of financial statements as per Schedule III
* Handling depreciation and fixed asset registers
* Statutory audits of companies, firms, and trusts
* Bank audits (Statutory, Concurrent, Stock & Revenue Audits)
* Income Tax Return filing and planning
* MCA filings ‚Äì AOC-4, MGT-7, MGT-14, DIR-3 KYC
* Practical training in Zoho Books, Tally Prime, and other ERP tools
* Exposure to cloud-based accounting and compliance systems
* Document management using Google Workspace and Zoho Suite
* Business process automation & virtual CFO support
* Exam support and study leave in line with ICAI norms
* Eagerness to learn and take ownership
* Willingness to travel locally for audit assignments

4275614222,https://in.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-audit-manager-change-delivery-malaysia-india-at-acca-careers-4275614222?position=3&pageNum=5&refId=dD7qGL97pzo%2B2lur%2FWW18Q%3D%3D&trackingId=BfNNtv6vKwXMB9SGlojr%2Bw%3D%3D,Senior Audit Manager - Change Delivery (Malaysia/India),ACCA Careers,"Cherthala, Kerala, India","Job Summary
Failure to effectively manage Change may lead to adverse client outcomes, breaches of regulatory requirements that could attract regulatory scrutiny, and/or damage the Group‚Äôs reputation.

Group Internal Audit (GIA) in Standard Chartered Bank is looking for an exceptional and dynamic Senior Audit Manager to join our Change Transformation Group Internal Audit (GIA) team within the Technology and Operations portfolio.

This global role includes executing audits across Ways of Working (WOW), project lifecycle, Classic and Agile delivery, project governance, reporting and monitoring, scheduling, resource management and financial management.

This role will get to work on more complex audits such as cross-functional and multi-location high risk audits and will also provide you the opportunities to interact and engage with both Group and Country Stakeholders
Maintain an awareness of the Group's business strategy and model, and an understanding of the Group‚Äôs Transformation priorities.
Perform, support, or lead where directed, the planning, fieldwork, and reporting of internal audit engagements to deliver agreed assurance objectives to established GIA standards and timelines.
Deliver quality audit reports that are effectively written with practical, actionable, measurable and value-added recommendations.
Share knowledge, skills and experience with team members and the wider GIA and provide advisory to internal auditors from both Business and Technology on Change Management.

Assist in standardisation and documentation of processes, risks, and controls and work with internal stakeholders to build a comprehensive and simple test procedures for Change Management. Liaise with Change Management standard owners where required.
Assist to track and consolidate all Change related audit issues raised by GIA, Regulators or Monitors and provide periodic updates to internal GIA Management and senior risk committees of the Bank.
Apply an in-depth understanding of, and compliance with, GIA methodology standards and the GIA system in all areas of assigned GIA activity.
Evaluate quantitative and qualitative data (using data analytics) to diagnose underlying issues, patterns and root causes.
Monitor and track assigned audit issues and action plans, and report overdue items to the Head of Audit (HOA) for resolution.
Execute audits in-line with the Group Internal Audit methodology.
Build good working relationships with the business audit teams to facilitate execution of integrated audit work.
Complete relevant risk assessment activities in a timely and effective manner, including the completion of Risk Assessment template.
Assist in continuous auditing and monitoring of key risks in Change Management.
Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the Group's arrangements to deliver effective Transformation governance, oversight, and controls.
Strong background in audit (with a focus on Change delivery and Agile concepts) with a minimum of 7 years of experience preferably in the Banking and Financial services industry.
Knowledge and experience in Change Management (e.g. Project Management Planning, Agile Practitioner) is required.
Attention to detail and curiosity. Strong analytical skills and eager to learn.
Excellent writing and articulation skills to succinctly communicate complicated technical issues in business terms.
Strong interpersonal skills for building and maintaining credibly effective working relationships with counterparts in Group Internal Audit and business stakeholders.
High degree of responsibility, self-motivated, requiring minimal supervision.
Ability to collect and objectively analyse and apply information, ‚Äúthinking out of the box‚Äù where necessary, in supporting the planning, fieldwork or reporting of results of audit engagements.
Displays initiative and knows when and how to seek guidance. Willingness and capacity to learn on the job.
Bachelor's or university degree in any related discipline.
Professional Audit Certification (CIA, CISA, CISM, CISSP etc.) and experience in executing a risk-based Audit Methodology, or a similar methodological approach.
Professional Certification (PMP, PRINCE2, Agile Scrum Master, PMI-ACP) in Change Management preferred.
Business proficiency in English (Verbal and Written)

We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. Are better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term
In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.
Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.

Time-off including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.

Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills,global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits

Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.
