Job Summary

Failure to effectively manage Change may lead to adverse client outcomes, breaches of regulatory requirements that could attract regulatory scrutiny, and/or damage the Group‚Äôs reputation.

  • Group Internal Audit (GIA) in Standard Chartered Bank is looking for an exceptional and dynamic Senior Audit Manager to join our Change Transformation Group Internal Audit (GIA) team within the Technology and Operations portfolio.
  • This global role includes executing audits across Ways of Working (WOW), project lifecycle, Classic and Agile delivery, project governance, reporting and monitoring, scheduling, resource management and financial management.
  • This role will get to work on more complex audits such as cross-functional and multi-location high risk audits and will also provide you the opportunities to interact and engage with both Group and Country Stakeholders

Key Responsibilities

  • Maintain an awareness of the Group's business strategy and model, and an understanding of the Group‚Äôs Transformation priorities.
  • Perform, support, or lead where directed, the planning, fieldwork, and reporting of internal audit engagements to deliver agreed assurance objectives to established GIA standards and timelines.
  • Deliver quality audit reports that are effectively written with practical, actionable, measurable and value-added recommendations.
  • Share knowledge, skills and experience with team members and the wider GIA and provide advisory to internal auditors from both Business and Technology on Change Management.
  • Assist in standardisation and documentation of processes, risks, and controls and work with internal stakeholders to build a comprehensive and simple test procedures for Change Management. Liaise with Change Management standard owners where required.
  • Assist to track and consolidate all Change related audit issues raised by GIA, Regulators or Monitors and provide periodic updates to internal GIA Management and senior risk committees of the Bank.
  • Apply an in-depth understanding of, and compliance with, GIA methodology standards and the GIA system in all areas of assigned GIA activity.
  • Evaluate quantitative and qualitative data (using data analytics) to diagnose underlying issues, patterns and root causes.
  • Monitor and track assigned audit issues and action plans, and report overdue items to the Head of Audit (HOA) for resolution.
  • Execute audits in-line with the Group Internal Audit methodology.
  • Build good working relationships with the business audit teams to facilitate execution of integrated audit work.
  • Complete relevant risk assessment activities in a timely and effective manner, including the completion of Risk Assessment template.
  • Assist in continuous auditing and monitoring of key risks in Change Management.
  • Responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the Group's arrangements to deliver effective Transformation governance, oversight, and controls.

Skills and Experience

  • Strong background in audit (with a focus on Change delivery and Agile concepts) with a minimum of 7 years of experience preferably in the Banking and Financial services industry.
  • Knowledge and experience in Change Management (e.g. Project Management Planning, Agile Practitioner) is required.
  • Attention to detail and curiosity. Strong analytical skills and eager to learn.
  • Excellent writing and articulation skills to succinctly communicate complicated technical issues in business terms.
  • Strong interpersonal skills for building and maintaining credibly effective working relationships with counterparts in Group Internal Audit and business stakeholders.
  • High degree of responsibility, self-motivated, requiring minimal supervision.
  • Ability to collect and objectively analyse and apply information, ‚Äúthinking out of the box‚Äù where necessary, in supporting the planning, fieldwork or reporting of results of audit engagements.
  • Displays initiative and knows when and how to seek guidance. Willingness and capacity to learn on the job.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor's or university degree in any related discipline.
  • Professional Audit Certification (CIA, CISA, CISM, CISSP etc.) and experience in executing a risk-based Audit Methodology, or a similar methodological approach.
  • Professional Certification (PMP, PRINCE2, Agile Scrum Master, PMI-ACP) in Change Management preferred.
  • Business proficiency in English (Verbal and Written)

About Standard Chartered

We're an international bank, nimble enough to act, big enough for impact. For more than 170 years, we've worked to make a positive difference for our clients, communities, and each other. We question the status quo, love a challenge and enjoy finding new opportunities to grow and do better than before. If you're looking for a career with purpose and you want to work for a bank making a difference, we want to hear from you. You can count on us to celebrate your unique talents and we can't wait to see the talents you can bring us.

Our purpose, to drive commerce and prosperity through our unique diversity, together with our brand promise, to be here for good are achieved by how we each live our valued behaviours. When you work with us, you'll see how we value difference and advocate inclusion.

Together We

  • Do the right thing and are assertive, challenge one another, and live with integrity, while putting the client at the heart of what we do
  • Never settle, continuously striving to improve and innovate, keeping things simple and learning from doing well, and not so well
  • Are better together, we can be ourselves, be inclusive, see more good in others, and work collectively to build for the long term

What we offer

In line with our Fair Pay Charter, we offer a competitive salary and benefits to support your mental, physical, financial and social wellbeing.

  • Core bank funding for retirement savings, medical and life insurance, with flexible and voluntary benefits available in some locations.
  • Time-off including annual leave, parental/maternity (20 weeks), sabbatical (12 months maximum) and volunteering leave (3 days), along with minimum global standards for annual and public holiday, which is combined to 30 days minimum.
  • Flexible working options based around home and office locations, with flexible working patterns.
  • Proactive wellbeing support through Unmind, a market-leading digital wellbeing platform, development courses for resilience and other human skills,global Employee Assistance Programme, sick leave, mental health first-aiders and all sorts of self-help toolkits
  • A continuous learning culture to support your growth, with opportunities to reskill and upskill and access to physical, virtual and digital learning.
  • Being part of an inclusive and values driven organisation, one that embraces and celebrates our unique diversity, across our teams, business functions and geographies - everyone feels respected and can realise their full potential.

Recruitment Assessments

Some of our roles use assessments to help us understand how suitable you are for the role you've applied to. If you are invited to take an assessment, this is great news. It means your application has progressed to an important stage of our recruitment process.

For further information, and to apply, please visit our website via the ‚ÄúApply‚Äù button below.

Candidates must be resident in Malaysia, or have the right to work in Malaysia.

Data Analyst (Contract-to-Hire)


Location: Zurich (On-site)

Start Date: ASAP

Contract Duration: 3 months (with potential for permanent hire)

Workload: 100%


About the Role

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join a dynamic team on a contract-to-hire basis. This is an exciting opportunity to make a tangible impact by transforming data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions.


Key Responsibilities

  • Analyze large datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights.
  • Build and maintain dashboards and reports to support various business functions.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver tailored solutions.
  • Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs).
  • Present data findings through compelling visualizations and storytelling.
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity through rigorous validation and quality checks.


Required Skills &
column2:
Qualifications

  • Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Excel).
  • Familiarity with Python or R.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to simplify complex data.

Additional Information


This is a trial-to-hire opportunity. Candidates should be open to transitioning into a permanent role after the initial 3-month contract, contingent on performance.

Enable common Western Europe product hierarchy and product mix analysis standardization (60%)

From the centre of the continent to the remote (and not-so-remote) coasts and islands, KFC Pan Europe is the iconic chicken restaurant brand with a unique history of innovation and success. Always original, our passion is high-quality, finger lickin‚Äô good chicken. Yes, we also have a secret recipe. No, we can‚Äôt share it. What we can share is our heart-led, welcoming culture, where you can be your best self, make a difference and have fun.

We‚Äôre part of Yum! Brands, Inc.‚Äîcollaborating across the world with our sister brands, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut and The Habit Burger Grill. KFC Pan Europe has three business units: Western Europe, Central & Eastern Europe and France. With more than 30 official languages in 150 different franchises, connecting with us is easier than ever. If you really want to do the math, we‚Äôve also got 2,200 restaurants in 40 countries. Either way, we keep it original.

For us, the future is all about connecting food traditions and tomorrow‚Äôs technology to innovate customer experiences, our global brand and the best fried chicken you‚Äôve ever tasted. We exist to feed people‚Äôs potential, valuing personal development and an inclusive culture. This also means having a keen social purpose and investing in mentorship, upskilling and food security. Creating opportunities for the most underserved and vulnerable groups in our communities helps grow new roots and strengthen bonds.

We want our people to be their best selves. So, we invest in skills, resources and each other. At our Pan Europe Academy, we develop leadership and train all levels of restaurant and corporate employees. From Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) to Individual Development Plans, we build meaningful careers that have real impact.
The bottom line? We bring it. Curious? We hope so.
Bring your spark, your spice and your original story. At KFC Pan Europe, we‚Äôre grounded in winning, celebrating, recognizing, welcoming and belonging. We've got a big table. You have a seat at it.

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.
Data Processing and ETL Development ‚Äì Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights ‚Äì Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration ‚Äì Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation ‚Äì Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting ‚Äì Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support ‚Äì Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.
Technical Proficiency ‚Äì Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure ‚Äì Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) ‚Äì Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication ‚Äì Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving ‚Äì Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.
Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities

  • Data Processing and ETL Development ‚Äì Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
  • Analysis and Insights ‚Äì Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
  • Collaboration ‚Äì Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
  • Automation ‚Äì Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
  • Documentation and Reporting ‚Äì Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
  • Customer Support ‚Äì Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.



Skills and Abilities

  • Technical Proficiency ‚Äì Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
  • Statistical and Analytical Skills ‚Äì Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
  • Data Engineering Exposure ‚Äì Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
  • GIS (Preferred but Not Required) ‚Äì Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
  • Communication ‚Äì Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Problem-Solving ‚Äì Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.

Qualifications

  • Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
  • Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
  • Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
  • Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
  • Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

This position is ideal for professionals who enjoy working with data, identifying trends, and translating analysis into actionable business insights while benefiting from a flexible work arrangement.

As a Data Analyst, you will collect, organize, and analyze large datasets from multiple sources to support strategic and operational initiatives. You will collaborate with various teams to design dashboards, create reports, and provide recommendations that drive informed decision-making.
The hybrid arrangement allows you to complete analysis tasks remotely while attending on-site sessions for collaborative projects and key presentations as required.
Gather, clean, and maintain data from internal and external sources.
Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Create and maintain dashboards, KPI tracking tools, and regular reports for stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven strategies and projects.
Automate data collection and reporting processes where possible.
Ensure data quality, integrity, and security at all times.
Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences.
Stay informed about new analytical tools and best practices.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
1‚Äì3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role.

column2: experience with Python, R, or other analytical tools is a plus.

column1: Strong knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms.
Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and organizational skills.
Strong communication skills and ability to explain complex concepts simply.
Ability to work independently in a hybrid environment while managing multiple tasks.
This hybrid, part-time role is perfect for professionals seeking to use their analytical skills to generate meaningful business insights while maintaining a flexible schedule.

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst (H/F) to join our team on a hybrid, part-time basis. This position is ideal for professionals who enjoy working with data, identifying trends, and translating analysis into actionable business insights while benefiting from a flexible work arrangement.

As a Data Analyst, you will collect, organize, and analyze large datasets from multiple sources to support strategic and operational initiatives. You will collaborate with various teams to design dashboards, create reports, and provide recommendations that drive informed decision-making.

The hybrid arrangement allows you to complete analysis tasks remotely while attending on-site sessions for collaborative projects and key presentations as required.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Gather, clean, and maintain data from internal and external sources.
  • Conduct in-depth analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
  • Create and maintain dashboards, KPI tracking tools, and regular reports for stakeholders.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven strategies and projects.
  • Automate data collection and reporting processes where possible.
  • Ensure data quality, integrity, and security at all times.
  • Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Stay informed about new analytical tools and best practices.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • 1‚Äì3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role.
  • Proficiency in Excel and SQL

experience with Python, R, or other analytical tools is a plus.
  • Strong knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar platforms.
  • Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and organizational skills.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to explain complex concepts simply.
  • Ability to work independently in a hybrid environment while managing multiple tasks.
  • This hybrid, part-time role is perfect for professionals seeking to use their analytical skills to generate meaningful business insights while maintaining a flexible schedule.

4275395130,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-%E2%80%93-bi-visualization-specialist-at-epam-systems-4275395130?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=QkHS7KnM40B%2BV4umuouADQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst ‚Äì BI & Visualization Specialist,EPAM Systems,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","EPAM is looking for a Data Analyst to support the data analytics team of a prestigious client in the luxury sector.
Based in our Geneva office in a hybrid setup, this is your chance to make a meaningful impact in a forward-thinking environment.
Would you like to be a part of this ambitious and innovative project? We look forward to receiving your application.
Develop data products across one or more business domains, in alignment with team objectives
Continuously enhance these products to ensure a seamless user experience and maintain data accuracy and consistency with source systems
Define and validate data ingestion workflows for the company‚Äôs data warehouse and data lakes, ensuring reliability and alignment with business needs
Drive adoption of self-service BI tools by engaging the user community through effective communication, training sessions and ongoing support
Contribute to the design and upkeep of reporting solutions, with a strong focus on developing impactful data visualizations using Tableau
Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with the Tableau suite, including Desktop, Server and Prep
Demonstrated advanced expertise in Tableau Desktop, particularly in environments integrating SAP BW and Snowflake as data sources
Excellent skills in data visualization, with a keen ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights
Strong knowledge of data modeling and data source development within BW data warehouses and/or Snowflake environments
Solid understanding of data processing techniques (extraction, transformation and loading), with hands-on experience using tools like Control-M and Dataiku
Strong interpersonal and time management skills, with the ability to effectively prioritize and deliver enhancements and new data products in a timely manner
Global business travel medical and accident insurance
Learning and development opportunities including in-house training and coaching, professional certifications, over 22,000 courses on LinkedIn Learning Solutions and much more
*All benefits and perks are subject to certain eligibility requirements
Please note that any offers will be subject to appropriate background checks
We do not accept CVs from recruiting or staffing agencies
For this position, we are able to consider applications from the following:
- Third-country nationals based in Switzerland with an appropriate work permit
- Displaced people from Ukraine who are currently in Switzerland and hold, or have already applied for, S permits

EPAM is looking for a Data Analyst to support the data analytics team of a prestigious client in the luxury sector.

Based in our Geneva office in a hybrid setup, this is your chance to make a meaningful impact in a forward-thinking environment.

Would you like to be a part of this ambitious and innovative project? We look forward to receiving your application.

Responsibilities


  • Develop data products across one or more business domains, in alignment with team objectives
  • Continuously enhance these products to ensure a seamless user experience and maintain data accuracy and consistency with source systems
  • Provide‚ÄØLevel 3 support‚ÄØfor these products
  • Define and validate data ingestion workflows for the company‚Äôs data warehouse and data lakes, ensuring reliability and alignment with business needs
  • Drive adoption of self-service BI tools by engaging the user community through effective communication, training sessions and ongoing support
  • Contribute to the design and upkeep of reporting solutions, with a strong focus on developing impactful data visualizations using Tableau


Requirements


  • Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with the Tableau suite, including Desktop, Server and Prep
  • Demonstrated advanced expertise in Tableau Desktop, particularly in environments integrating SAP BW and Snowflake as data sources
  • Excellent skills in data visualization, with a keen ability to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights
  • Strong knowledge of data modeling and data source development within BW data warehouses and/or Snowflake environments
  • Solid understanding of data processing techniques (extraction, transformation and loading), with hands-on experience using tools like Control-M and Dataiku
  • Strong interpersonal and time management skills, with the ability to effectively prioritize and deliver enhancements and new data products in a timely manner
  • Fluent in French


We offer


  • 5 weeks of vacation
  • EPAM Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Extended pension plan
  • Daily sickness allowance insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Global business travel medical and accident insurance
  • Learning and development opportunities including in-house training and coaching, professional certifications, over 22,000 courses on LinkedIn Learning Solutions and much more
  • *All benefits and perks are subject to certain eligibility requirements
  • Please note that any offers will be subject to appropriate background checks
  • We do not accept CVs from recruiting or staffing agencies
  • For this position, we are able to consider applications from the following:
  • - Swiss nationals
  • - EU/EFTA nationals
  • - Third-country nationals based in Switzerland with an appropriate work permit
  • - Displaced people from Ukraine who are currently in Switzerland and hold, or have already applied for, S permits

4253185810,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-product-analytics-at-getyourguide-4253185810?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=uWycuUOKyrhyxlaBUW%2BqAg%3D%3D,"Data Analyst, Product Analytics",GetYourGuide,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will support the Fulfillment mission‚Äîimproving the post-booking experience, empowering suppliers, and enabling Care to resolve issues efficiently. You‚Äôll work across the analytics funnel to drive measurement, strategy, and decision-making. Example problems include quantifying the impact of improved pickup selection on defect rate, identifying drivers of booking issues, or evaluating how post-booking communication affects traveller sentiment and retention.
Design and analyze A/B tests to evaluate product changes and guide decision-making.
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions
Help the product teams to learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams‚Äô product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.
2-3 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Ability to communicate data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders, influencing decisions across product, engineering, and operations
Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.
How We Set You Up For Success
Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences.
The opportunity to contribute to the
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.
We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team Mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will support the Fulfillment mission‚Äîimproving the post-booking experience, empowering suppliers, and enabling Care to resolve issues efficiently. You‚Äôll work across the analytics funnel to drive measurement, strategy, and decision-making. Example problems include quantifying the impact of improved pickup selection on defect rate, identifying drivers of booking issues, or evaluating how post-booking communication affects traveller sentiment and retention.

You will

  • Design and analyze A/B tests to evaluate product changes and guide decision-making.
  • Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions
  • Help the product teams to learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
  • Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams‚Äô product strategy and success.
  • Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
  • Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.

Who You Are

  • 2-3 years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
  • Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
  • Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
  • Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
  • Ability to communicate data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders, influencing decisions across product, engineering, and operations

Nice to have

  • Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
  • Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
  • Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
  • Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
  • Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.

How We Set You Up For Success

  • Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences.
  • The opportunity to contribute to the
  • A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
  • Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
  • English-speaking office environment
  • Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
  • Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
  • Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
  • GetYourGuide vouchers.

And more‚Ä¶

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Based in Fribourg, our client supports other business units by providing them with technical and logistical equipment essential to their activities.

As part of an organizational transformation, our client is looking to strengthen its team by recruiting a product data management and administrative support associate. This person will play a key role in processing and monitoring product information, in coordination with the technical and IT teams.
‚Ä¢ Create, update, and maintain master data in the ERP (SAP), including items, inventory, suppliers, bills of materials, and locations.
‚Ä¢ Oversee the quality, consistency, and integrity of data throughout its lifecycle.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the Logistics, Maintenance, Production, and Plantation teams to ensure reliable information (locations, thresholds, reorder levels, units of measure, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Identify and correct naming, translation, coding, and duplicate entries in the existing database (approximately 60,000 items).
‚Ä¢ Participate in the redesign of the NIR (New Item Request) tool in collaboration with the IT and business teams, and in the definition of new procedures.
‚Ä¢ Define and document data management procedures in accordance with internal rules.
‚Ä¢ Define reporting and quality control tools (dashboards, audits, KPIs).
‚Ä¢ Work in pairs to monitor item statuses (obsolete, non-renewable, etc.) and ensure business continuity.
‚Ä¢ Provide support and coordination on data migration projects (SAGE), particularly during the mapping, cleaning, and inventory reliability phases.
‚Ä¢ Actively participate in improving Supply Chain processes by providing a reliable database for planning, purchasing, and operational decisions.
‚Ä¢ Train and raise awareness among internal users on best data management practices, particularly through the new NIR tool.
Education: Bachelor's degree in industrial management, data management, industrial IT, supply chain, CFC or equivalent training.
Experience: Minimum 3 years in an industrial environment with extensive exposure to inventory management and ERP issues.
Proficiency in ERP systems (SAP) and a good understanding of industrial processes are must-haves (procurement, production, maintenance).
Native French and English (C1 level required).
Knowledge of Power BI or other visualization tools is an asset
Commitment to quality and continuous improvement
Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team (production, logistics, IT).
Team spirit and a sense of teamwork.
Please send your CV and supporting documents in English.

About us:


Based in Fribourg, our client supports other business units by providing them with technical and logistical equipment essential to their activities.


As part of an organizational transformation, our client is looking to strengthen its team by recruiting a product data management and administrative support associate. This person will play a key role in processing and monitoring product information, in coordination with the technical and IT teams.


Your responsibilities:


‚Ä¢ Create, update, and maintain master data in the ERP (SAP), including items, inventory, suppliers, bills of materials, and locations.

‚Ä¢ Oversee the quality, consistency, and integrity of data throughout its lifecycle.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with the Logistics, Maintenance, Production, and Plantation teams to ensure reliable information (locations, thresholds, reorder levels, units of measure, etc.).

‚Ä¢ Identify and correct naming, translation, coding, and duplicate entries in the existing database (approximately 60,000 items).

‚Ä¢ Participate in the redesign of the NIR (New Item Request) tool in collaboration with the IT and business teams, and in the definition of new procedures.

‚Ä¢ Define and document data management procedures in accordance with internal rules.

‚Ä¢ Define reporting and quality control tools (dashboards, audits, KPIs).

‚Ä¢ Work in pairs to monitor item statuses (obsolete, non-renewable, etc.) and ensure business continuity.

‚Ä¢ Provide support and coordination on data migration projects (SAGE), particularly during the mapping, cleaning, and inventory reliability phases.

‚Ä¢ Actively participate in improving Supply Chain processes by providing a reliable database for planning, purchasing, and operational decisions.

‚Ä¢ Train and raise awareness among internal users on best data management practices, particularly through the new NIR tool.


Your Profile:


Education: Bachelor's degree in industrial management, data management, industrial IT, supply chain, CFC or equivalent training.

Experience: Minimum 3 years in an industrial environment with extensive exposure to inventory management and ERP issues.


Skills and Knowledge:

Proficiency in ERP systems (SAP) and a good understanding of industrial processes are must-haves (procurement, production, maintenance).

Database knowledge (SQL)

Advanced Excel

Native French and English (C1 level required).

Knowledge of Power BI or other visualization tools is an asset


Soft Skills:

Administrative rigor and analytical mind

Commitment to quality and continuous improvement

Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team (production, logistics, IT).

Initiative and autonomy

Team spirit and a sense of teamwork.

Strength and resilience


Please send your CV and supporting documents in English.

4277600026,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-international-air-transport-association-iata-4277600026?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=74VxfOpjhaYimbbInfoTjQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst,International Air Transport Association (IATA),"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Employment Type: Permanent
Why you will love working here
At IATA, we represent over 350 airlines worldwide, striving to make aviation safer, smarter, more sustainable, and inclusive.

Our Values are not just words on a page - they are the energy behind everything we do: ONE IATA - We collaborate across teams, TRUSTED - We do the right thing, INNOVATIVE - We make tomorrow better, INCLUSIVE - We embrace diverse perspectives.
With over 30,000 courses available, we believe in continuous learning and support your growth in an ever-changing industry.
Diversity, equity, and inclusion are our priorities. We are certified by the Equal Salary Foundation, offering equal pay and family-friendly policies.
We encourage community involvement through volunteering and strive to make tomorrow better for aviation and our communities. We offer time off so you can support causes important to you.
We promote work-life balance with flexible work options, including remote and hybrid work, a generous 'work from abroad' policy, and you get your birthday off!
About The Team You Are Joining

Part of the Information and Data (I&D) Division, Data Governance team works to define and implement state-of-the-art data practices within our organization to make data and analytics more accessible, trustworthy, and actionable. Our goal is to maximizes the investment in data and analytics initiatives by promoting the proper use of analytics in business processes, ensuring accurate insights based on quality data, reducing risks with security, and guiding the prioritization of projects so the right information is available at the right time.

Reporting to the Senior Manager Data Governance and Modelling, the Data Analyst will be involved in the processes of cleansing, analysing, interpreting, and displaying data using different approaches and business intelligence tools and assisting in uncovering key insights that lead to better informed decision-making.
What Your Day Would Be Like

As a Data Analyst, the incumbent will be working with business teams and other information technology professionals to support data collection processes, interpret various forms of data and present them in a useful and easy-to-understand manner . The responsibilities of the Data Analyst will:
Develop and maintain data collection pipelines, data analytics and other processes that leverage statistical methodology
Analyse data and explore it for insights using statistical methods to test hypotheses, identify trends, and make predictions
Interpret data, analyse results, generate information and insights from data sets and identify trends and patterns
Perform analysis of data and write technical reports and presentations

Assess quality of data and participate in data cleansing and preparation, including, but not limited to, removing errors, identifying outliers, and transforming data into a format that can be analysed
Create dashboards and reports that communicate insights to stakeholders
Collaborate with other employees, including engineers and programmers, to determine areas of improvement in relation to data.
We would love to hear from you if
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in computer/data science, mathematics, information management, statistics or related fields
Professional experience in a similar position
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (Snowflake, SQL etc), programming (R, XML, Python), and ETL framework
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analysing datasets
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences
Fluent reading, writing and speaking abilities in English.
Learn more about IATA‚Äôs role in the industry, our benefits, and the team at iata/careers/ . We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Employment Type: Permanent

Contract Duration

 Why you will love working here

At IATA, we represent over 350 airlines worldwide, striving to make aviation safer, smarter, more sustainable, and inclusive.

  • Our Values are not just words on a page - they are the energy behind everything we do: ONE IATA - We collaborate across teams, TRUSTED - We do the right thing, INNOVATIVE - We make tomorrow better, INCLUSIVE - We embrace diverse perspectives.
  • With over 30,000 courses available, we believe in continuous learning and support your growth in an ever-changing industry.

We are seeking a tech-savvy and analytically driven FinTech Data Analyst / AI Consultant to join our team. 4278330683,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-business-analyst-power-bi-specialist-at-reliefweb-4278330683?position=17&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=wJntGHNSkkidqsM6T2QX7g%3D%3D,Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist,ReliefWeb,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Switzerland
Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist
Join MSF OCG as a Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist!
We are looking for passionate candidates ready to contribute to our humanitarian mission.
Below, you will find the job details and the qualifications we are looking for.
Do your qualifications and experience not exactly match all requirements of the job?

At MSF OCG, we are committed to an inclusive culture that supports and amplifies the diverse voices of our staff members. We strive to create workplaces where teams of people with diverse backgrounds, characteristics, perspectives, ideas and experiences work together to advance MSF's social mission and create better outcomes for our patients and the communities we work with.

We understand that some people may hesitate to apply for employment if they don't meet all listed job requirements. Research shows that this is especially true for women. If you believe your profile is a good match for this position, we invite you to apply even if you don‚Äôt fulfil every listed qualification.
We encourage applications from individuals of all genders, ages, sexual orientations, ethnicities, background, religions, beliefs, ability status, and all other diversity characteristics.
MSF does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of discrimination or harassment, including sexual harassment. All selected candidates will undergo reference checks.

M√©decins Sans Fronti√®res is an independent, international medical and humanitarian organization that provides care to people in need, people affected by natural or man-made disasters, and victims of armed conflict, without discrimination and without regard to race, religion, creed or political affiliation (MSF Charter).
The MSF movement is built around 5 operational centers supported by 24 sections and offices worldwide. MSF Operational Center Geneva (MSF OCG) is one of these centers.

Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights? At MSF Switzerland, we're looking for a Data Business Analyst & Power BI Specialist to play a key role in shaping our self-service data platform and enterprise reporting.

In this role, you‚Äôll wear two hats. First, as a Business Analyst, you‚Äôll work closely with different departments to understand their reporting needs, listening, analyzing, and documenting requirements to ensure we‚Äôre solving the right problems. Then, you‚Äôll switch gears and become our Power BI expert, building intuitive reports, clean datasets, and powerful semantic models using Power BI and Microsoft Fabric.

You won‚Äôt be working in isolation. You‚Äôll be a vital part of a cross-functional project team alongside our Data Architect, Data Engineers, and key stakeholders, you will be part of the BRIDGE (Bringing Resources & Intelligence for Dynamic Global Engagement) project team, integrated to the DIP (Data, Innovation and Project) section, which is part of the DSI (Direction of the Systems of Information).
You‚Äôll help make sure everything we build aligns with both business goals and our data governance standards, thus influencing the adoption of the new dashboards.
If you're ready to dive into a meaningful data journey and make a real difference through your work, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.
Fixed-term contract for 12 months, with potential for renewal based on evolving project requirements.
Business Needs Collection: Collect, analyze, and structure reporting needs across departments and domains.
Requirements Documentation: Translate business requirements into documented reporting specifications and data needs.
Request Prioritization: Prioritize and organize reporting requests and ensure traceability from request to solution.
Governed Reporting Design: Participate in the design and evolution of a governed reporting environment using Power BI and Microsoft Fabric.
Report & Dashboard Implementation: Build and deploy interactive, user-friendly reports and dashboards tailored to business objectives.
Certified Dataset Development: Develop and maintain certified, reusable datasets aligned with enterprise data standards.
Content Documentation: Document reporting content, usage guidelines, and data logic to ensure transparency and consistency.
User Support & Training: Actively contribute to user onboarding, training, and support for self-service data tools.
Tertiary degree, university degree, or equivalent in data analytics, information systems, business intelligence, or a related field
Certifications in Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, or related tools are an asset
You have at least 4 years of experience in roles that blend business analysis with data-focused project delivery.
You‚Äôre confident translating complex business questions into clear, impactful reporting solutions.
You‚Äôve had hands-on involvement in BI development‚Äîbuilding datasets and contributing to dashboards.
English and French are the working languages of MSF Switzerland. Fluency in both English and French is required for this position (oral and written).
Gather and structure reporting requirements from multiple business domains
Translate operational and analytical needs into functional specifications
Ensure alignment between business needs and existing data capabilities
Build and maintain interactive reports, dashboards, and data visualizations
Design and manage reusable datasets and semantic models in Power BI and support data quality
Leverage Microsoft Fabric, Pw BI platform for modelling, orchestration, and platform integration
Align reporting solutions with enterprise data governance and architecture
Document all deliverables (datasets, visuals, business rules, KPIs, usage)
Contribute to user onboarding, training sessions, and guidance material
Ensure consistency and clarity in metrics and data definitions across reports
Work as part of a broader data project team, supporting implementation milestones
Collaborate with the Data Architect, Data Engineers, and business stakeholders
Support cross-functional testing, feedback cycles, and continuous improvement
Gross annual salary (for 100%): from CHF 94‚Äô440.- to CHF 108‚Äô348.- (salary commensurate with equivalent experience and internal salary grid)
Paid vacation: 25 days per year, prorate temporis, plus any Swiss public holidays falling within the contract period.
Pension plan: pension contribution covered 3/4 by MSF, 1/4 by staff member.
Relocation package if moving from a different country to Switzerland.
Candidates are invited to submit their application exclusively through our recruitment platform, following these guidelines:
Documents must be submitted in either English or French.
We reserve the right to close this vacancy earlier if we receive a sufficient number of quality applications.
All applications will be treated confidentially.
Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
Please note that we do not wish to use the services of recruitment or placement agencies.

Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

At Roche, our Finance Centers of Excellence have led the way in breaking down silos, removing hierarchies, and working in new ways. We‚Äôve learned from our successes and from the things that haven‚Äôt gone so well. We‚Äôre better equipped to look at interfaces and synergies, and to understand the risks of creating new silos. The eCoE is focusing on three areas delivering a high-level of financial expertise, innovative insights, and an entrepreneurial mindset that enables agility and flexibility for stakeholders. The eCoE is a talent engine for Finance through capability and network building.

Within the eCOE, the R&D Outcome Based Community (OBC) focuses on delivering a high-level of fifinancial expertise, innovative insights, and an entrepreneurial mindset to influence and support R&D investments at Roche.

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented R&D Benchmarking Analyst to support our R&D organization. This role focuses on collecting, analyzing, and interpreting internal and external data to benchmark R&D performance, costs, timelines, and success rates in molecule development. You will play a critical role in shaping R&D strategy through competitive intelligence, pipeline assessment, and knowledge management.
Conduct R&D benchmarking studies focused on preclinical and clinical development phases across therapeutic areas and molecule types
Main point of contact for external benchmark analysis providing, collecting, validating and analyzing benchmark data points to/from our selected external provider
Analyze molecule development costs, timelines, success rates, using internal project data and external sources
Support cross-functional teams by providing actionable insights to improve pipeline productivity and decision-making
Develop and maintain internal databases and dashboards on R&D metrics, competitive programs, and industry trends
Collaborate with portfolio management, therapeutic area leads, and external providers to contextualize benchmarking insights
Track industry best practices and innovations in drug discovery, translational research, and clinical development
Synthesize large datasets and scientific knowledge into concise reports and presentations for senior leadership
Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Pharmacy, Medicine, or related field
2‚Äì5 years of experience in pharmaceutical R&D, competitive intelligence, or management consulting (with pharma focus)
Strong understanding of molecule development stages (discovery to early/late-phase clinical development)
Familiarity with R&D KPIs: time-to-launch, timelines, cost of failure, cycle times, etc
Excellent data analysis and visualization skills (Excel, PP, SAC,...)
Strong communication skills with ability to translate complex data into strategic insights

You have the ability to turn data into insights, comfortable with zooming in and out on details and granularity depending on the situation. You are a collaborative team player with ability to deal with ambiguous situations and deliver in a networked setup. You are courageously authentic with ability to speak up and point out opportunities.
The role is located in Basel.

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100‚Äô000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.
Let‚Äôs build a healthier future, together.

4271818237,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-research-analyst-at-sts-digital-group-4271818237?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=ooR7Aoxh%2B6Qy7Q0Z2lc1Xg%3D%3D,Quantitative Research Analyst,STS Digital Group,"Zurich, Switzerland","Quantitative Analyst

We are seeking a motivated Quantitative Analyst to join our quantitative trading team. In this role, you will collaborate closely with quantitative researchers on designing, testing, and refining algorithmic trading strategies while leveraging quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and risk management techniques in the cryptocurrency market. This is an excellent opportunity to work at the cutting edge of quantitative finance and help us serve an expanding and increasingly sophisticated client base.
Apply advanced statistical methods and financial modeling to systematic option market-making and risk management.
Conduct volatility surface modeling and calibration, option (exotics) pricing, liquidity analysis, and other related analyses.
Design, refine, and optimize algorithmic trading strategies by designing efficient order placement and scheduling algorithms, integrating short-term alpha signals to minimize slippage.
Utilize internal trading data and perform post-trade analysis to validate trading performance and recommend improvements tailored to the trading strategies.
Collaborate with portfolio and risk management teams to develop and implement tools for performance analysis and risk management.

Collaborate with the trading desk to research and evaluate new trading ideas and opportunities within the cryptocurrency market, leveraging large datasets and advanced statistical methods to automate trading decisions and improve existing strategies.
Contribute to documentation, ensuring that all processes, algorithms, and models are clearly described for internal stakeholders.
Strong academic foundation in quantitative finance, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or a related field.
Strong mathematical and statistical modeling skills, including proficiency in statistical modeling, derivatives pricing, and volatility surface analysis.
Familiarity with algorithmic trading, order book flow, and options trading is beneficial but not mandatory.
Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively within cross-functional teams.
Collaborative mindset to work with developers and other analysts to implement trading ideas and analytical tools.
Genuine interest in cryptocurrency markets and algorithmic trading and eagerness to learn, solve complex problems, and adapt quickly in a rapidly evolving environment.

Quantitative Analyst


Position Overview

We are seeking a motivated Quantitative Analyst to join our quantitative trading team. In this role, you will collaborate closely with quantitative researchers on designing, testing, and refining algorithmic trading strategies while leveraging quantitative analysis, statistical modeling, and risk management techniques in the cryptocurrency market. This is an excellent opportunity to work at the cutting edge of quantitative finance and help us serve an expanding and increasingly sophisticated client base.


Key Responsibilities

  • Apply advanced statistical methods and financial modeling to systematic option market-making and risk management.
  • Conduct volatility surface modeling and calibration, option (exotics) pricing, liquidity analysis, and other related analyses.
  • Design, refine, and optimize algorithmic trading strategies by designing efficient order placement and scheduling algorithms, integrating short-term alpha signals to minimize slippage.
  • Utilize internal trading data and perform post-trade analysis to validate trading performance and recommend improvements tailored to the trading strategies.
  • Collaborate with portfolio and risk management teams to develop and implement tools for performance analysis and risk management.
  • Collaborate with the trading desk to research and evaluate new trading ideas and opportunities within the cryptocurrency market, leveraging large datasets and advanced statistical methods to automate trading decisions and improve existing strategies.
  • Contribute to documentation, ensuring that all processes, algorithms, and models are clearly described for internal stakeholders.


Requirements

  • Strong academic foundation in quantitative finance, mathematics, statistics, computer science, or a related field.
  • Strong mathematical and statistical modeling skills, including proficiency in statistical modeling, derivatives pricing, and volatility surface analysis.
  • Exceptional Python programming skills.
  • Familiarity with algorithmic trading, order book flow, and options trading is beneficial but not mandatory.
  • Ability to communicate complex ideas clearly and effectively within cross-functional teams.
  • Collaborative mindset to work with developers and other analysts to implement trading ideas and analytical tools.
  • Genuine interest in cryptocurrency markets and algorithmic trading and eagerness to learn, solve complex problems, and adapt quickly in a rapidly evolving environment.

4273270995,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-insights-intern-m-f-x-d-6-months-100%25-at-swiss-re-4273270995?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=5O2jgoesKcrGleScHInPlw%3D%3D,"Data & Insights Intern (m/f/x/d, 6 months, 100%)",Swiss Re,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Are you passionate about transforming complex financial data into meaningful insights? Join our dynamic Life & Health Reinsurance Finance team where you'll develop valuable skills in data analysis, financial reporting, and business intelligence while making a real impact on global business decisions!

As a Data & Insights Intern, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making process, providing crucial transparency into our global Life & Health business operations through sophisticated data analysis and visualization.
Analyze IFRS data and contribute to building robust data pipelines that transform raw information into actionable insights
Develop deep understanding of Life & Health business operations and IFRS reporting methodologies affecting income statements and balance sheets
Process and interpret performance measures and technical aspects of risk selection under IFRS reporting frameworks
Transform complex data from multiple sources into compelling visual narratives that support executive decision-making
Create standardized visualizations that effectively communicate key data stories and business messages to senior leadership
Collaborate cross-functionally with Regional Finance and Actuarial teams across multiple countries
The position is located in Zurich and the start date would be September 15, 2025.

Within Reinsurance Finance, our Data & Insights team is responsible for comprehensive financial data analysis and the continuous enhancement of information-sharing tools for Life & Health Reinsurance worldwide. We leverage our extensive data resources and company network to provide senior management with critical insights into business performance, guiding them toward accurate and impactful decisions. Our team serves as a CFO function for both the Head of Life & Health Products and the Head of Life & Health Business Management. We maintain close collaboration with pricing and actuarial teams globally to ensure the highest quality of financial information and insights.

You're an analytical thinker with a passion for translating numbers into meaningful stories. You thrive in collaborative environments and are eager to apply your technical skills to real-world business challenges. Your curiosity drives you to explore new technologies and methodologies that can enhance data processing and visualization.
We Are Looking For Candidates Who Meet These Requirements
Completed bachelor or master degree in statistics, economics, finance, business administration, or natural sciences
Strong analytical skills with the ability to critically evaluate numbers and draw relevant conclusions
Proficient in MS Excel and programming languages such as PySpark, Python, R, or similar tools
Basic understanding of financial statements, particularly IFRS17 principles
Excellent communication skills with fluency in written and spoken English
These Are Additional Nice To Haves
Experience with cloud technology for developing data pipelines
Knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques
Previous internship experience in finance, data analysis, or related fields
We are looking forward to your application, including CV and cover letter!
The base salary range for this position will be shared with you during the interview process.

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.
If you are an experienced professional returning to the workforce after a career break, we encourage you to apply for open positions that match your skills and experience.

Are you passionate about leveraging data to enhance customer satisfaction? We are offering a six-month internship focused on developing innovative solutions for improving customer experience. Join our team and contribute to a project that will enable organizations to systematize and prioritize customer experience improvement initiatives.
Conduct data reviews and perform gap analysis to evaluate the structure, quality, and completeness of current datasets
Develop statistical rules and algorithms for prioritizing actions and detecting interdependencies
Establish mechanisms to track the outcomes of customer satisfaction initiatives
Analyze the accuracy and maturity of current datasets and propose methods to test and validate the framework
Lay the foundation for future predictive models
Create a reporting and visualization system for stakeholders
Currently enrolled in a Master's program in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field
Experience with data analysis and statistical modeling
Good in Python or R for data analysis
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and predictive modeling
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken
Ability to work independently and as part of an interdisciplinary team

Our diverse and inclusive work environment encourages collaboration and continuous learning, ensuring that every team member has the opportunity to grow Join us and be part of a company that is shaping the future of sustainable energy solutions.

Hitachi Energy is a global technology leader in electrification, powering a sustainable energy future through innovative power grid technologies with digital at the core. Over three billion people depend on our technologies to power their daily lives.

With over a century in pioneering mission-critical technologies like high-voltage, transformers, automation, and power electronics, we are addressing the most urgent energy challenge of our time ‚Äì balancing soaring electricity demand, while decarbonizing the power system.
Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ over 50,000 people in 60 countries and generate revenues of around $16 billion USD. We welcome you to apply today.

  • Lay the foundation for future predictive models
  • Create a reporting and visualization system for stakeholders

  • Experience with data analysis and statistical modeling
  • Good in Python or R for data analysis
  • Familiarity with machine learning concepts and predictive modeling
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken
  • Ability to work independently and as part of an interdisciplinary team

4274327282,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/consultant-data-analysis-zurich-at-ey-4274327282?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=t6X9%2B5pHr9veDvNUIt%2BZ0Q%3D%3D,Consultant Data Analysis - Zurich,EY,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders.
In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

The timely and relevant financial information provided by EY's Assurance teams is essential to global economic health and sustainable growth. Our work helps to restore and maintain public confidence in the world‚Äôs capital markets and ensure that the fundamentals are in place for businesses to move forward. Start your career in a practice rich in opportunity - the scale and scope of our clients‚Äô businesses add to the wealth of experience that a career in Assurance EY offers you.

The ADD Team within Assurance practice supports the audit all over Switzerland in data extraction and transformation for further analytics in order to build trust and to ensure clarity, transparency in the Digital Audit of the future.

As a DID Consultant, you will collaborate with our EY clients, senior data analysts, and auditors to enable a data-driven approach. You will oversee the end-to-end data delivery process, from gathering client data to preparing the necessary data analytics solutions for audit procedures.
Support the creation and delivery of key analytical solutions for Assurance teams.
Work with a robust set of tools and infrastructure to cleanse, store, and manipulate data, following industry standards for data security and privacy.
Apply problem-solving skills to address unexpected technical or operational challenges, including communication with Assurance teams and clients across Switzerland.
Conduct business validation and QA testing of audit analytics content and solutions.

You will join a dynamic, international, and multicultural environment, benefiting from a structured learning path focused on data science, accounting, and auditing. In addition to formal training, you will receive intensive on-the-job learning and coaching.
To qualify for the role you must have
A Master degree (or equivalent) in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
Solid experience with SQL, Python, Alteryx, or similar tools used for data extraction, transformation, and manipulation.
Ability to work independently, manage pressure effectively, and meet deadlines.
Excellent oral and written communication skills

Do you have challenging plans? Stick to them and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education. In an environment that constantly opens new doors through knowledge sharing, flexibility and recognition. We offer you to join our highly motivated team.

You will be working and learning in a highly dynamic and cross-functional team - being able to boost your learning curve through the combination of intensive teamwork, challenging projects and being part of the network of one of the world‚Äôs leading professional services firms.
We are looking forward to receiving your application.

EY is a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders.

In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

The timely and relevant financial information provided by EY's Assurance teams is essential to global economic health and sustainable growth. Our work helps to restore and maintain public confidence in the world‚Äôs capital markets and ensure that the fundamentals are in place for businesses to move forward. Start your career in a practice rich in opportunity - the scale and scope of our clients‚Äô businesses add to the wealth of experience that a career in Assurance EY offers you.

The ADD Team within Assurance practice supports the audit all over Switzerland in data extraction and transformation for further analytics in order to build trust and to ensure clarity, transparency in the Digital Audit of the future.

As a DID Consultant, you will collaborate with our EY clients, senior data analysts, and auditors to enable a data-driven approach. You will oversee the end-to-end data delivery process, from gathering client data to preparing the necessary data analytics solutions for audit procedures.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Support the creation and delivery of key analytical solutions for Assurance teams.
  • Work with a robust set of tools and infrastructure to cleanse, store, and manipulate data, following industry standards for data security and privacy.
  • Apply problem-solving skills to address unexpected technical or operational challenges, including communication with Assurance teams and clients across Switzerland.
  • Conduct business validation and QA testing of audit analytics content and solutions.

You will join a dynamic, international, and multicultural environment, benefiting from a structured learning path focused on data science, accounting, and auditing. In addition to formal training, you will receive intensive on-the-job learning and coaching.

To qualify for the role you must have

  • A Master degree (or equivalent) in Business Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
  • Solid experience with SQL, Python, Alteryx, or similar tools used for data extraction, transformation, and manipulation.
  • Ability to work independently, manage pressure effectively, and meet deadlines.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Proficiency in German and English.

More opportunities for your development

Do you have challenging plans? Stick to them and realize your goals with us! Design your career with EY in a culture that promotes diversity and education. In an environment that constantly opens new doors through knowledge sharing, flexibility and recognition. We offer you to join our highly motivated team.

You will be working and learning in a highly dynamic and cross-functional team - being able to boost your learning curve through the combination of intensive teamwork, challenging projects and being part of the network of one of the world‚Äôs leading professional services firms.

We are looking forward to receiving your application.

Take the next step and apply for this position online.
