4264115754,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4264115754?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=6%2FAWhpUpE4LmEkNK%2BVAbHw%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Basel, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

4276595702,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-digital-analytics-consultant-h-f-geneva-at-fifty-five-4276595702?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=h7aFCwYcvpPpfKkS5u9P4A%3D%3D,Senior Digital Analytics Consultant H/F (Geneva),fifty-five,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands transform with data and AI to improve their marketing operations through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.
As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York. fifty-five attaches particular importance to the well-being of its employees, which enabled it to be included in the Best Workplaces France ranking in 2018.

Within the consulting team based in Geneva, you will actively take part in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple clients. Those projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation, media-mix optimisation and digital business consulting. During these projects, you will contribute to promoting a customer-centred vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions. You will work across multiple industries including luxury, FMCG, sport, and beauty.

You will report to a Local Executive Director and will work closely with Product, Engineering and Operations Teams based in Paris. As a data analyst and consultant, you will follow an action plan, issuing step-by-step the deliverables required for successful delivery of the project. You will guarantee the integrity of analytics data as well as its analysis and interpretation in working with your team and client.

You will be responsible for the content, the format and overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation where required. Based on your good understanding of our projects and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.

Deliver projects related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimization through data analysis and webtesting, to online media buy optimization and CRM
Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in consistency with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
Meet clients' needs and pay strong attention to the quality of all deliverables
Occasional travel possible, within Switzerland or abroad (including Paris)
Master's degree (business, engineering) or equivalent diploma
1 to 3 years experience in digital marketing, consulting firms, marketing or business intelligence software, or media agencies
Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: SEO, SEM and bidmanagement, display and programmatic, affiliates, email and social media
Fluent in French & English and excellent communication, oral and written
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analysis, statistical software and data vizualization tool
Strong interest in new technologies and the digital industry

55 provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions

Within the consulting team based in Geneva, you will actively take part in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple clients. Those projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation, media-mix optimisation and digital business consulting. During these projects, you will contribute to promoting a customer-centred vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions. You will work across multiple industries including luxury, FMCG, sport, and beauty.

You will report to a Local Executive Director and will work closely with Product, Engineering and Operations Teams based in Paris. As a data analyst and consultant, you will follow an action plan, issuing step-by-step the deliverables required for successful delivery of the project. You will guarantee the integrity of analytics data as well as its analysis and interpretation in working with your team and client.

You will be responsible for the content, the format and overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation where required. Based on your good understanding of our projects and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.

Responsibilities

  • Deliver projects related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimization through data analysis and webtesting, to online media buy optimization and CRM
  • Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in consistency with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
  • Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
  • Meet clients' needs and pay strong attention to the quality of all deliverables
  • Occasional travel possible, within Switzerland or abroad (including Paris)

Education And Experience

  • Master's degree (business, engineering) or equivalent diploma
  • 1 to 3 years experience in digital marketing, consulting firms, marketing or business intelligence software, or media agencies
  • Working with web analytics tools
  • Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: SEO, SEM and bidmanagement, display and programmatic, affiliates, email and social media

Skills and Interests

This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

4264136745,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-center-operations-analyst-at-servicenow-4264136745?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=pHcwfm9sUo2qxmcxwfV9wQ%3D%3D,Data Center Operations Analyst,ServiceNow,"Opfikon, Zurich, Switzerland","Company Description

It all started in sunny San Diego, California in 2004 when a visionary engineer, Fred Luddy, saw the potential to transform how we work. Fast forward to today ‚Äî ServiceNow stands as a global market leader, bringing innovative AI-enhanced technology to over 8,100 customers, including 85% of the Fortune 500¬Æ. Our intelligent cloud-based platform seamlessly connects people, systems, and processes to empower organizations to find smarter, faster, and better ways to work. But this is just the beginning of our journey. Join us as we pursue our purpose to make the world work better for everyone.

Data Center Operations Team manages the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center. Oversees systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships. Responsible for capacity planning and continual assessments for process improvement to ensure that processes are well-documented, sustainable, and scalable. Monitors ongoing practices to ensure consistency with policies, compliance regulations and control requirements. Selects, develops, and evaluates personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the function. Roles can have an internal or external client focus. May involve company-hosted, Web-enabled solutions or may include project-based jobs in conjunction with Professional Services and outsourcing functions.
This role is primarily based at our data centre facility in Geneva.
What You Get To Do In This Role
Prioritize and assign trouble tickets to data center engineers.
Manage the performance of data center operations with varying skills across Switzerland location.
Ensure effective and efficient management of day-to-day data center operations including queue management, 7/24 shift arrangement and hardware logistics.
Subject matter expert across all aspects in data center operations especially in DCIM integrations.
Ensure all operational KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) and metrics are being measured and met.
Responsible for reporting key metrics to peer teams.
Inspire and guide improvement in team process, technology innovation and automation.
Manage Large Scale Events, Incident management - responsible for communications to executive stakeholders.
Manage and build workflows for data centers operations.
Has a solid understanding of all critical Mechanical & Electrical infrastructure.
Recommend, document, and oversee policies and procedures to meet industry best practices and to meet required SLAs (Service Level Agreement).
Maintain the on-call schedule coordinating absence and vacations.
Be passionate about the quality and quantity of services being provided, and continuously strive to improve our Customer Experience.
To be successful in this role you have:
4+ years of experience in data center operations management
Experience of managing the planning, hardware installation and configuration, optimization, operations, and ongoing maintenance of the computer/data center.
Holistic experience of overseeing systems performance, the monitoring of equipment and the management of vendor relationships.
Experience of capacity planning and continual assessments for DC.
Good knowledge of data center facilities and infrastructure including power, HVAC, structured cabling, rack management and security.
Experience managing vendors in a data center environment.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to multi-task several unrelated issues.
General documentation skills with particular emphasis on technical processes and standards.
Knowledge and experience in ITIL process methodologies a plus.
Proven ability to function in ambiguous situations with a record of success.
Excellent communication, customer focus, problem solving, conflict management, time management and interpersonal skills required.
A deep passion for Sustainability and compliance to support our customers global impact responsibilities .
Some travel would be required--domestically and internationally.
Although data center experience is key, the successful candidate will be self-motivated and positive with a passion for developing new skills.
What You Can Expect From Us

At ServiceNow, we make work better for everyone ‚Äì including our own employees. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible for our employees. Win as a Team is part of our culture, and we aspire to wow our customers. We stay hungry and humble and focus on creating belonging. Sustainability, inclusivity, and diversity are key focus areas within our business framework so that we have transparency, equity, and accountability to deliver meaningful, measurable change. With our vision and dedication for a better future already underway. Join us on this journey!

In addition to a competitive salary, supportive teams, and a real opportunity to progress in your career with a forward-thinking organisation, we provide resources to help you and your loved ones be well. From benefits plans and programs, to mental health resources that offer coaching and 24/7 support, to family support resources and parental leave programs ‚Äì we want to help you take care of yourself and your loved ones. Below is a glimpse into even more of our offerings or click here for a full list:
Along with holidays, we have company-wide designated global well-being days where everyone is off and can spend time doing what matters most.
Good working culture to support the balance you need in both work and life.
A learning experience platform built using our own technology, to support your learning and development goals as well as a tuition reimbursement program.
We also have team building activities, various employee belonging groups, volunteering, and community outreach programs.

We approach our distributed world of work with flexibility and trust. Work personas (flexible, remote, or required in office) are categories that are assigned to ServiceNow employees depending on the nature of their work and their assigned work location. Learn more here. To determine eligibility for a work persona, ServiceNow may confirm the distance between your primary residence and the closest ServiceNow office using a third-party service.

ServiceNow is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other category protected by law. In addition, all qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with legal requirements.

We strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are unable to use this online application and need an alternative method to apply, please contact globaltalentss@servicenow.com for assistance.

For positions requiring access to controlled technology subject to export control regulations, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may be required to obtain export control approval from government authorities for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by relevant export control authorities.

4264119168,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4264119168?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=v1hzGttAWINma8kPL7YjsQ%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Nidwalden, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world‚Äôs largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.
Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

In order to be hired into the program, you‚Äôll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft f√ºr Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterst√ºtzen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Daf√ºr suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!

M√∂chtest du Teil eines interdisziplin√§ren Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung √ºbernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und erm√∂glichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.
Du bist f√ºr das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zust√§ndig.
Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
Du verantwortest die technische Qualit√§t, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien f√ºr Datenpipelines und -modelle.
Du bist zust√§ndig f√ºr das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und L√∂sungsans√§tzen.
Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
Du schulst und bef√§higst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten L√∂sungen.
Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.
Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:
Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
Starke analytische F√§higkeiten, Probleml√∂sungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamf√§higkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Franz√∂sisch von Vorteil
Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus
üöÄ Bereit f√ºr die n√§chste Herausforderung? Werde Teil von Scigility und gestalte die Zukunft der Datenarchitektur mit uns!

Data Engineer

Z√ºrich/Fribourg


Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft f√ºr Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterst√ºtzen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Daf√ºr suchen wir per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine:n Data Engineer, der moderne Data Solutions entwickelt und unsere Kunden in der digitalen Transformation begleitet. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!



So schaffst du Mehrwert

M√∂chtest du Teil eines interdisziplin√§ren Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung √ºbernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und erm√∂glichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.


Deine Hauptaufgaben:

  • Du bist f√ºr das Design, die Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenarchitekturen, Pipelines und Data Products zur Sicherstellung effizienter Analyse- und Transformationsprozesse zust√§ndig.
  • Du wendest Ingestion Patterns und Best Practices in der Datenverarbeitung erfolgreich an.
  • Du verantwortest die technische Qualit√§t, Implementierung und Optimierung von Testing-Strategien f√ºr Datenpipelines und -modelle.
  • Du bist zust√§ndig f√ºr das Stakeholder-Management und die Kommunikation von Risiken, Herausforderungen und L√∂sungsans√§tzen.
  • Du arbeitest eng mit unseren Kunden hinsichtlich Anforderungsanalyse und technischer Umsetzung zusammen.
  • Du schulst und bef√§higst unsere Kunden-Teams zur effektiven Nutzung der entwickelten L√∂sungen.
  • Du stellst eine umfassende Dokumentation und den Wissenstransfer innerhalb des Teams sicher.
  • Du leistest einen wertvollen Beitrag zur Weiterentwicklung unseres internen Frameworks und der Verbesserung der Projektstandards und Best Practices.


Was dich zur idealen Besetzung macht:

  • Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
  • Mindestens 3-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder Software Engineer mit Fokus auf Datenverarbeitung
  • Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse in Python
  • Kenntnisse in Big Data- und verteilten Systemen wie Spark, Kafka, Flink, und Trino
  • Erfahrung in der Entwicklung und Optimierung von Datenpipelines (Batch und Streaming) mit Technologien wie Airflow, Meltano oder NiFi
  • Erfahrung mit Cloud-Technologien, idealerweise in mehr als einer Plattform (Azure, AWS, GCP, Cloudera) und sowohl On-Prem- als auch Cloud-Umgebungen
  • Starke analytische F√§higkeiten, Probleml√∂sungskompetenz und eine schnelle Auffassungsgabe
  • Ausgezeichnete Kommunikations-, Teamf√§higkeiten und Stakeholder Management Skills
  • Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- (C2) und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, Franz√∂sisch von Vorteil



Optionale Superkr√§fte:

  • Erfahrung in der Beratung und im Umgang mit Kundenprojekten
  • Kenntnisse im Bereich Data Governance, Compliance und regulatorischen Anforderungen
  • Erfahrung mit Container- und Orchestrierungstechnologien wie OpenShift, Kubernetes oder Docker
  • Software-Engineering-Hintergrund, Erfahrung mit weiteren Sprachen wie Java, Scala sind ein Plus

4265338517,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-intern-at-vf-corporation-4265338517?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=XIGapWkTsrORhfYShRcIPw%3D%3D,Data Engineer Intern,VF Corporation,"Stabio, Ticino, Switzerland","Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.
Must be graduating within or after November 2025
These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.
By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.
Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.
What will make a candidate successful?
Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.
Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.
A master degree in STEM disciplines is required a pre-requisite given the nature of the role.
We are looking for someone who has demonstrated:
The ability to understand the data flow in the VF business processes.
The capability to troubleshoot complex data issues and propose a feasible solution.
An understanding of modern data architecture, cloud computing, traditional AI and GenAI.
An expertise in using SQL and Python like a master.
A keen interest in exploring new technologies for data management and GenAI.

The VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey designed to develop and empower emerging talent at the start of their careers. As a company committed to unleashing human potential‚Äîfueled by the ideas, energy, and dedication of our people‚Äîyou can expect a structured learning path and rich hands-on experience, including:
Collaborate on an internal consulting group project
Gain on-the-ground insight about our brands during a store visit day
Connect through networking opportunities with peers and senior leadership

In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.
We want you to focus on what matters, that‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:
A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands

As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity.We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.
If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!
ARE YOU IN? Apply now ‚Äì early application increases your chances!

Be a dreamer, make the difference! Join #VFInternship in our EMEA HQ in Stabio, Switzerland as Data Engineer Intern for Digital Technologies.

Eligibility Requirements:

  • EU / EEA citizenship
  • Must be graduating within or after November 2025

These requirements are related to local legislation hence there is no flexibility in the application.

Let‚Äôs talk about the role!

As Data Engineer Intern you will build and maintain the data pipelines that power analytics and machine learning, ensuring reliable, scalable access to high-quality data in our Global Data Foundation platform.

By transforming raw data into structured insights, they enable smarter business decisions and accelerate innovation.

Below a list focusing on the most impactful responsibilities:

  • Build and maintain scalable data pipelines and integrations to ensure timely and reliable data availability for analytics and reporting.
  • Transform and clean raw data from multiple sources into structured formats to support business intelligence and machine learning use cases.
  • Monitor and optimize data workflows and storage solutions to improve performance, reduce costs, and ensure data quality.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., Data Scientists, Analysts, Product Owners) to understand data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
  • Document and maintain data architecture, processes, and best practices to support team knowledge sharing and onboarding.
  • Support other initiatives and projects as part of the Global Data Engineering team, contributing to innovation and continuous improvement efforts.

What You Bring

What will make a candidate successful?

  • Demonstrates strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data manipulation, transformation, and automation.
  • Understands data architecture principles and is familiar with cloud platforms (Azure) and data platforms Databricks. With modern data frameworks like Spark, Databricks, dbt.
  • Communicates effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to align on data requirements and deliverables.
  • Shows attention to detail in ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and documentation.
  • Learns quickly and adapts to evolving technologies and project priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Collaborates proactively within cross-functional teams to support data-driven decision-making.

Competences Required:

  • Data modeling intuition: understands how to structure data for performance, scalability, and usability, not just storage.
  • Pipeline reliability mindset: builds with monitoring, testing, and failure recovery in mind, ensuring robust data flows.
  • Code quality discipline: writes clean, modular, and well-documented code that others can easily understand and build upon.
  • Curiosity-driven problem solving: proactively explores data issues and business questions, going beyond assigned tasks.

A master degree in STEM disciplines is required a pre-requisite given the nature of the role.

We are looking for someone who has demonstrated:

  • The ability to understand the data flow in the VF business processes.
  • The capability to troubleshoot complex data issues and propose a feasible solution.
  • An understanding of modern data architecture, cloud computing, traditional AI and GenAI.
  • An expertise in using SQL and Python like a master.
  • A keen interest in exploring new technologies for data management and GenAI.

What‚Äôs In It For You

The VF EMEA Internship Program is a 12-month journey designed to develop and empower emerging talent at the start of their careers. As a company committed to unleashing human potential‚Äîfueled by the ideas, energy, and dedication of our people‚Äîyou can expect a structured learning path and rich hands-on experience, including:

  • Participate in dedicated skill-building workshops
  • Collaborate on an internal consulting group project
  • Gain on-the-ground insight about our brands during a store visit day
  • Connect through networking opportunities with peers and senior leadership

In the role of Data Engineer Intern you will work with an international team worldwide, discovering all secrets of how manage data in a successful enterprise. We will support you with ad hoc trainings, coaching and networking opportunities across all VF brands and shared functions.

We want you to focus on what matters, that‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical, and financial well-being. You will enjoy:

  • A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us
  • An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities work together
  • Being part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi-brand, multi country organization
  • On-site gym offering health and well-being initiatives, break out areas with complimentary drinks
  • A discount card with 50% on all VF brands

Free to Be, Inclusion &

As a key member of the Finance Digital Transformation team, you will be at the forefront of driving digital solutions within our entity. You will be directly responsible for end-to-end development and implementation of digital tools and solutions. You will lead the design, security assessment, development, and deployment of solutions that leverage financial data to drive transformation and continuous improvement.
This role involves collaborating, exchanging ideas, and working on adapting solutions with different regions and departments within the organization.
How will you make an impact?
Reporting to the Finance Digital Transformation Manager and based in Villars-sur-G√¢ne, this role will be responsible for the following responsibilities, including but not limited to:
Gather requirements and identify business intelligence and automation opportunities in Accounts Payable, Treasury, Financial Planning and Internal Controls
Develop, optimize, and maintain existing solutions (BI or Automation), ensuring seamless integration with the company's environment and compliance requirements
Establish and enforce best practices for data management, solution development, and secure deployment
Create comprehensive documentation to support and maintain business processes and data analysis/automation efforts
Translate complex data insights into actionable solutions
Leverage and implement the latest available technologies and tools in close collaboration with Group Finance, Group Data Office, and Group Technology
Present deliverables and participate in the exchange of ideas during sharing sessions within wider Richemont communities
Coach and mentor less experienced team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?
University degree in Finance, Data science, Mathematics or similar
8-10 years of relevant experience, including at least 5 years in a data analyst role
Strong track record of successfully driving end-to-end projects with concrete business outcomes through data analysis and automation
Professional experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud and/or Looker
Hands on experience with data modelling and data transformation/cleaning (SQL, PowerQuery) and programming languages/algorithms
Hands on experience with automation tools such as Power Automate and/or UiPath
Previous experience with data management in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Microsoft SQL Server is a strong asset
Experience in finance within the industrial sector is a plus
High ability to collect, organize and analyze high volume of complex data
Pragmatic and solution-oriented with ability to quickly evaluate, learn, put to use and integrate new technologies
Team player with ability to interact with a variety of professionals at every level of the organization
Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner
Agile with ability to work in a complex, fast paced and demanding environment
Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.
We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity.
We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity.
We care for the world we live in.

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will give you a follow-up shortly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will be an interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

BACKGROUND

As a key member of the Finance Digital Transformation team, you will be at the forefront of driving digital solutions within our entity. You will be directly responsible for end-to-end development and implementation of digital tools and solutions. You will lead the design, security assessment, development, and deployment of solutions that leverage financial data to drive transformation and continuous improvement.

This role involves collaborating, exchanging ideas, and working on adapting solutions with different regions and departments within the organization.

How will you make an impact?

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Finance Digital Transformation Manager and based in Villars-sur-G√¢ne, this role will be responsible for the following responsibilities, including but not limited to:

  • Gather requirements and identify business intelligence and automation opportunities in Accounts Payable, Treasury, Financial Planning and Internal Controls
  • Develop, optimize, and maintain existing solutions (BI or Automation), ensuring seamless integration with the company's environment and compliance requirements
  • Establish and enforce best practices for data management, solution development, and secure deployment
  • Create comprehensive documentation to support and maintain business processes and data analysis/automation efforts
  • Translate complex data insights into actionable solutions
  • Leverage and implement the latest available technologies and tools in close collaboration with Group Finance, Group Data Office, and Group Technology
  • Present deliverables and participate in the exchange of ideas during sharing sessions within wider Richemont communities
  • Coach and mentor less experienced team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Education, Experience And Core Competencies

  • University degree in Finance, Data science, Mathematics or similar
  • 8-10 years of relevant experience, including at least 5 years in a data analyst role
  • Strong track record of successfully driving end-to-end projects with concrete business outcomes through data analysis and automation
  • Professional experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud and/or Looker
  • Hands on experience with data modelling and data transformation/cleaning (SQL, PowerQuery) and programming languages/algorithms
  • Hands on experience with automation tools such as Power Automate and/or UiPath
  • Previous experience with data management in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Microsoft SQL Server is a strong asset
  • Experience in finance within the industrial sector is a plus

Personal, Methodological And Social Skills

  • High ability to collect, organize and analyze high volume of complex data
  • Pragmatic and solution-oriented with ability to quickly evaluate, learn, put to use and integrate new technologies
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Team player with ability to interact with a variety of professionals at every level of the organization
  • Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner
  • Agile with ability to work in a complex, fast paced and demanding environment

WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.

  • We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity.
  • We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity.
  • We care for the world we live in.

YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will give you a follow-up shortly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will be an interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika‚Äôs around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data & Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Z√ºrich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.
What to expect in your first 6 Months
Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.
Begin making initial platform improvements and laying the groundwork for scalable ETL/ELT pipelines
Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.
Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.
A degree in Computer Science, Management of Information Systems, Data Science, or equivalent professional experience
column2: Relevant certifications on Data Engineering are a plus.

column1: Several years of experience in Data Engineering or relevant role.
Familiarity with domain-oriented data management approaches, such as Data Mesh.
Experience with Azure services such as Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Storage Account, Key Vault.
Coding experience with languages such as SQL, Python, PySpark, dbt
Experience working with code versioning tools such as Azure DevOps or GitHub.
Experienced with DevOps principles such as CI/CD pipelines and release processes

column2: proficiency in additional languages is a plus.

Job Description

Sika is expanding rapidly, and our data requirements are growing just as fast. To meet these needs, we are shaping a global strategy for how Sika manages and leverages analytical data, and we are building a state-of-the-art cloud-based data analytics platform.

Join our Central Data &
column2:
Analytics Team as a Data Engineer in Z√ºrich, where you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing innovative solutions for data engineering and analytics. In this position, you will directly influence the architecture and execution of our new global data analytics approach, helping to set the standard for how Sika utilizes data to drive business value.

Month 1-2

What to expect in your first 6 Months

  • Get to know the existing data architecture, technology stack, and key data sources (e.g., SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others).
  • Deepen your understanding of our data mesh concept and its implementation.
  • Build relationships with our team, data domain specialists, and stakeholders.

Month 3-4

  • Design, build, and maintain production-grade ETL/ELT pipelines to load and transform data from enterprise systems (SAP S/4Hana, Salesforce, SAP ByDesign, others) into structured formats.
  • Implement data transformation processes using tools like Azure Databricks, dbt and Azure Data Factory, ensuring alignment with business logic and analytics needs.
  • Establish automated data quality checks, consistency monitoring, and validation frameworks to ensure reliable data availability.

Month 5-onwards

  • Collaborate with domain specialists to deliver data products for analytics and AI use cases.
  • Fine-tune pipelines and data models for performance (query optimization, partitioning) and cost-efficiency (autoscaling, storage tiering).
  • Develop reusable templates and documentation to enable domain teams to build their own ETL/ELT pipelines in alignment with global standards.
  • Contribute to strategic decisions about platform evolution, including evaluation of new tools and architectural patterns.

Qualifications

4269393519,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-data-management-data-platforms-focus-at-deloitte-4269393519?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=VQyCd9gK8bqbJjZBx5vzGw%3D%3D&trackingId=m7tsbSfnZbP95tINi8yexg%3D%3D,Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus),Deloitte,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Description
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
For this role, we are currently offering start dates from August 2025.
How You Can Make An Impact
Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.

Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.
Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data ‚Äì how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria
column2: don‚Äôt hold yourself back ‚Äì apply today.

4276595702,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-digital-analytics-consultant-h-f-geneva-at-fifty-five-4276595702?position=3&pageNum=2&refId=JXdrifoAdRh3%2B657ZnEsUw%3D%3D&trackingId=%2FdYbhVX9%2BakS2ZbvcUFlMQ%3D%3D,Senior Digital Analytics Consultant H/F (Geneva),fifty-five,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands transform with data and AI to improve their marketing operations through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.
As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +320 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York. fifty-five attaches particular importance to the well-being of its employees, which enabled it to be included in the Best Workplaces France ranking in 2018.

Within the consulting team based in Geneva, you will actively take part in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple clients. Those projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation, media-mix optimisation and digital business consulting. During these projects, you will contribute to promoting a customer-centred vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions. You will work across multiple industries including luxury, FMCG, sport, and beauty.

You will report to a Local Executive Director and will work closely with Product, Engineering and Operations Teams based in Paris. As a data analyst and consultant, you will follow an action plan, issuing step-by-step the deliverables required for successful delivery of the project. You will guarantee the integrity of analytics data as well as its analysis and interpretation in working with your team and client.

You will be responsible for the content, the format and overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation where required. Based on your good understanding of our projects and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.

Deliver projects related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimization through data analysis and webtesting, to online media buy optimization and CRM
Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in consistency with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
Meet clients' needs and pay strong attention to the quality of all deliverables
Occasional travel possible, within Switzerland or abroad (including Paris)
Master's degree (business, engineering) or equivalent diploma
1 to 3 years experience in digital marketing, consulting firms, marketing or business intelligence software, or media agencies
Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: SEO, SEM and bidmanagement, display and programmatic, affiliates, email and social media
Fluent in French & English and excellent communication, oral and written
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analysis, statistical software and data vizualization tool
Strong interest in new technologies and the digital industry

This policy applies to all terms and conditions

As a key member of the Finance Digital Transformation team, you will be at the forefront of driving digital solutions within our entity. You will be directly responsible for end-to-end development and implementation of digital tools and solutions. You will lead the design, security assessment, development, and deployment of solutions that leverage financial data to drive transformation and continuous improvement.
This role involves collaborating, exchanging ideas, and working on adapting solutions with different regions and departments within the organization.
How will you make an impact?
Reporting to the Finance Digital Transformation Manager and based in Villars-sur-G√¢ne, this role will be responsible for the following responsibilities, including but not limited to:
Gather requirements and identify business intelligence and automation opportunities in Accounts Payable, Treasury, Financial Planning and Internal Controls
Develop, optimize, and maintain existing solutions (BI or Automation), ensuring seamless integration with the company's environment and compliance requirements
Establish and enforce best practices for data management, solution development, and secure deployment
Create comprehensive documentation to support and maintain business processes and data analysis/automation efforts
Translate complex data insights into actionable solutions
Leverage and implement the latest available technologies and tools in close collaboration with Group Finance, Group Data Office, and Group Technology
Present deliverables and participate in the exchange of ideas during sharing sessions within wider Richemont communities
Coach and mentor less experienced team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?
University degree in Finance, Data science, Mathematics or similar
8-10 years of relevant experience, including at least 5 years in a data analyst role
Strong track record of successfully driving end-to-end projects with concrete business outcomes through data analysis and automation
Professional experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud and/or Looker
Hands on experience with data modelling and data transformation/cleaning (SQL, PowerQuery) and programming languages/algorithms
Hands on experience with automation tools such as Power Automate and/or UiPath
Previous experience with data management in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Microsoft SQL Server is a strong asset
Experience in finance within the industrial sector is a plus
High ability to collect, organize and analyze high volume of complex data
Pragmatic and solution-oriented with ability to quickly evaluate, learn, put to use and integrate new technologies
Team player with ability to interact with a variety of professionals at every level of the organization
Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner
Agile with ability to work in a complex, fast paced and demanding environment
Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.
We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity.
We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity.
We care for the world we live in.

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will give you a follow-up shortly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will be an interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

BACKGROUND

As a key member of the Finance Digital Transformation team, you will be at the forefront of driving digital solutions within our entity. You will be directly responsible for end-to-end development and implementation of digital tools and solutions. You will lead the design, security assessment, development, and deployment of solutions that leverage financial data to drive transformation and continuous improvement.

This role involves collaborating, exchanging ideas, and working on adapting solutions with different regions and departments within the organization.

How will you make an impact?

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Finance Digital Transformation Manager and based in Villars-sur-G√¢ne, this role will be responsible for the following responsibilities, including but not limited to:

  • Gather requirements and identify business intelligence and automation opportunities in Accounts Payable, Treasury, Financial Planning and Internal Controls
  • Develop, optimize, and maintain existing solutions (BI or Automation), ensuring seamless integration with the company's environment and compliance requirements
  • Establish and enforce best practices for data management, solution development, and secure deployment
  • Create comprehensive documentation to support and maintain business processes and data analysis/automation efforts
  • Translate complex data insights into actionable solutions
  • Leverage and implement the latest available technologies and tools in close collaboration with Group Finance, Group Data Office, and Group Technology
  • Present deliverables and participate in the exchange of ideas during sharing sessions within wider Richemont communities
  • Coach and mentor less experienced team members, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Education, Experience And Core Competencies

  • University degree in Finance, Data science, Mathematics or similar
  • 8-10 years of relevant experience, including at least 5 years in a data analyst role
  • Strong track record of successfully driving end-to-end projects with concrete business outcomes through data analysis and automation
  • Professional experience with data visualization software such as PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud and/or Looker
  • Hands on experience with data modelling and data transformation/cleaning (SQL, PowerQuery) and programming languages/algorithms
  • Hands on experience with automation tools such as Power Automate and/or UiPath
  • Previous experience with data management in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and/or Microsoft SQL Server is a strong asset
  • Experience in finance within the industrial sector is a plus

Personal, Methodological And Social Skills

  • High ability to collect, organize and analyze high volume of complex data
  • Pragmatic and solution-oriented with ability to quickly evaluate, learn, put to use and integrate new technologies
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Team player with ability to interact with a variety of professionals at every level of the organization
  • Ability to communicate in a clear and concise manner
  • Agile with ability to work in a complex, fast paced and demanding environment

WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

Our true power does not lie in our similarities but in the rich diversity of our arts, cultures, and human skills, as well as our specific ability to foster untapped potential.

  • We value freedom, collegiality, loyalty, and solidarity.
  • We foster empathy, curiosity, courage, humility, and integrity.
  • We care for the world we live in.

YOUR JOURNEY WITH US

Your application will be carefully reviewed by our recruitment teams, who will give you a follow-up shortly. If your profile is selected, we will contact you for an initial phone interview. The next step will be an interview with the Managers and our HR Business Partner.

We are a diverse team of more than 2.700 Kaizeners, from 40+ nationalities spreading across 3 continents.
Our #oneteam is proud to be among the Best Workplaces in Europe and certified Great Place to Work across our offices. Here, there‚Äôll be no average day for you. Ready to Press Play on Potential?
We are looking for an outstanding Data Analyst to join our fast-growing BI & Analytics team and contribute to the expansion of our Kaizen Gaming functions during an exciting scale-up data journey.
As a Data Analyst you will:
Build strong relationships with stakeholders, proactively providing data analyses and insights to the function

Communicate insights and recommendations effectively to stakeholders enabling them to make better-informed business decisions
Continuously assess and refine existing metrics and KPIs and work closely with the rest of Business Intelligence (BI) to develop new ones that drive business growth
Work closely with the rest of BI team to ensure alignment, adopt best practices in data visualization, and facilitate seamless information flow from the hub to the spoke and vice versa
Contribute to fostering a strong data-driven culture across the organization
Design and develop data intelligence solutions, including analysis, reporting and dashboards of key metrics and KPIs.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Operations Research, or similar
Experience in a reporting, statistical or quantitative role‚Äîexperience in the gaming industry would be considered a plus
Analytical mindset and detail-oriented with ability to focus and prioritize workload
Exceptional data storytelling skills and the ability to articulate technical information to a non-technical audience
Strategic thinker with the ability to collaborate and engage with senior stakeholders
High drive, can-do attitude, proactive, and adaptable to changing business demands
Advanced proficiency in SQL, as well as strong skills in MS-Excel and Google Sheets (pivot tables, v-lookups)
Working experience with Microsoft Power BI would be considered a plus (or other dashboarding tools such as Tableau)
Working experience with Python would also be considered a plus (especially Pandas, Numpy, and other relevant libraries for data analysis)

At Kaizen Gaming, we value innovation, collaboration and continuous improvement. If you're passionate about leveraging data to drive business success and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we'd love to hear from you.

The mission of the New York Police Department is to enhance the quality of life in our city by working in partnership with the community to enforce the law, preserve peace, protect the people, reduce fear, and maintain order. The NYPD strives to foster a safe city by incorporating Neighborhood Policing into all facets of Department operations and solve the problems that create crime and disorder through an interdependent relationship between people and its police, and by pioneering strategic innovation.
The Human Resources Division, Staffing Administration Section seeks a qualified candidate for Staff Analyst, I to assist with Department operations.
The Staff Analyst, I will be responsible for reviewing and analyzing assigned communications for civilian promotions, upgrades, title changes and salary adjustments

‚Ä¢ Experience creating, debugging and performance optimizing with PySpark jobs (Glue jobs, Serverless PySpark on GCP)

‚Ä¢ Experience creating, debugging and performance optimizing with DataFlow jobs (Apache Beam)

‚Ä¢ Experience creating documentation and architecture diagrams.

‚Ä¢ Demonstrated experience using both schema driven and schema-free cloud-based storage solutions and platform implementation in a technical and analytical role

‚Ä¢ Experience with benchmarking/tuning for performance across different platforms

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with tools designed for efficiently transferring bulk data and parallel processing of data stored across data environments

‚Ä¢ Experience building API connections and transferring large data sets between internal systems and vendor systems a plus

‚Ä¢ Basic statistical analysis or statistical modeling experience with R or Python a plus

‚Ä¢ Ideal candidates have experience working in Media, Television or Digital Marketing


Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Experience working with Snowflake-data driven warehouses

‚Ä¢ Experience creating, debugging and performance optimizing with PySpark jobs (Glue jobs, Serverless PySpark on GCP)

‚Ä¢ Experience with distributed data technologies (Hadoop, HDFS, Spark, Apache Beam)

‚Ä¢ Experience creating, debugging and performance optimizing with DataFlow jobs (Apache Beam)

‚Ä¢ Any data science experience


Company:

Optimum Media provides innovative, data-driven multiscreen advertising solutions reaching every DMA in the U.S. Founded in 2018, the company is headquartered in Long Island City, New York, USA, with a team of 501-1000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. Optimum Media has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.
