Paid Days Off from Day One

Joining AdventHealth is about being part of something bigger. Its about belonging to a community that believes in the wholeness of each person, and serves to uplift others in body, mind and spirit. AdventHealth is a place where you can thrive professionally, and grow spiritually, by Extending the Healing Ministry of Christ. Where you will be valued for who you are and the unique experiences you bring to our purpose-minded team. All while understanding that together we are even better.
The Community You'll Be Caring For

Located on a lush tropical campus, our flagship hospital, 1,368-bed AdventHealth Orlando. Serves as the major tertiary facility for much of the Southeast, the Caribbean and South America. AdventHealth Orlando houses one of the largest Emergency Departments and largest cardiac catheterization labs in the country. We are already one of the busiest hospitals in the nation, providing service excellence to more than 32,000 inpatients and 125,000 outpatients each year

The Consumer Experience Analyst will be an integral part of the Corporate Services Consumer Experience team within AdventHealth. In this role, you will have a successful track record of breaking down complex business ideas, analyzing data inputs and delivering key Consumer focused information to a variety of audiences. You will need to partner with managers, researchers, technologists, and operators to deliver impactful analysis supporting solutions for our Consumers. AdventHealth will depend on you to help drive solutions, processes, and technologies to create the greatest impact on the overall Consumer experience. The Consumer Experience Analyst works closely with Consumer team colleagues to research, develop, and influence product solutions and key Consumer efforts based on team strategy and vision. This role is inherently cross-functional: you will work closely with technology, design, operations, analytics and executive teams to bring solutions to market. You will have the opportunity to summarize research, report on data driven insights, research and document consumer friction points as well as bring creative thinking to complex solutions.
Responsible for understanding, and analyzing a variety of data inputs and research related to key consumer promise and aspirational initiatives
Proven success record in analyzing, developing, building and executing first-in-class services and/or experiences
Translates the product vision into a set of detailed, comprehensive product requirements such as user stories, business rules and acceptance criteria.
Ensures the execution of creative assets developed in support of initiatives to ensure adherence to strategic vision.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills, including experience in using hard data and metrics to support assumptions, product requirements, activation and solutioning.

Ensures new capabilities, improvements and/or enhancements are well integrated and vetted within the AdventHealth ecosystem including proactively partnering and collaborating with impacted upstream/downstream matrixed areas.
Proven ability to think strategically, execute methodically and manage competing priorities simultaneously.
Thoroughly tests and validates accuracy of all work product.
Attends cross functional Consumer project meetings to help drive priority decisions and remove roadblocks.
Supports multiple cross-functional Consumer teams to ensure a solid understanding of the defined scope.
Conducts research, analysis and mystery shops as needed in support of solving Consumer pain points and performance gaps.
Research and synthesize Consumer insight inputs to effectively develop communications for
Summarize and present research findings using digestible language and illustrations
Organize agendas and key action items from meetings with large groups of cross functional participants and executive stakeholders.
Minimum 2 years of experience working as a business analyst, product analyst or similar role, with at least 1 year in a leadership role
Ability to think strategically and turn ideas into action, with a positive outlook, personal initiative and accountability.
Exceptional verbal and written communication and project leadership skills, including an ability to communicate effectively to cross-functional teams.
Strong presentation and documentation skills to build research summaries, communications and product models for executive review.
Demonstrated ability to identify, understand, and drive resolution of complex critical issues.

Proven ability as a team player able to collaborate with and achieve actionable results through others, plus the ability to build strong and sustainable relationships, and the capability to interact within all levels of an organization.
Experience interviewing and communicating with third party vendors and external technology services to elevate product solutions to the team.
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, synergizing many inputs into effective action plans or communications

  • Proven ability to think strategically, execute methodically and manage competing priorities simultaneously.

  • Supports multiple cross-functional Consumer teams to ensure a solid understanding of the defined scope.

  • Research and synthesize Consumer insight inputs to effectively develop communications for
  • senior level audiences.
  • Summarize and present research findings using digestible language and illustrations
  • Organize agendas and key action items from meetings with large groups of cross functional participants and executive stakeholders.

Qualifications

Education And Experience Required

  • Bachelor's Required
  • Minimum 2 years of experience working as a business analyst, product analyst or similar role, with at least 1 year in a leadership role
  • Ability to think strategically and turn ideas into action, with a positive outlook, personal initiative and accountability.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication and project leadership skills, including an ability to communicate effectively to cross-functional teams.
  • Strong presentation and documentation skills to build research summaries, communications and product models for executive review.
  • Demonstrated ability to identify, understand, and drive resolution of complex critical issues.
  • Proven ability as a team player able to collaborate with and achieve actionable results through others, plus the ability to build strong and sustainable relationships, and the capability to interact within all levels of an organization.
  • Experience interviewing and communicating with third party vendors and external technology services to elevate product solutions to the team.
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, synergizing many inputs into effective action plans or communications

You will join the Customer Intelligence Team of Enel X Global Retail that is in charge of creating Advanced Analytics and providing actionable insights to drive business growth and optimize our marketing and sales strategies.What You‚Äôll do‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain an accurate and up-to-date data model to support business analyses and strategic decisions.‚Ä¢ Analyze and interpret customer data to identify trends, behaviors, and market opportunities, such as predicting churn and identifying potential up-selling and cross-selling opportunities.‚Ä¢ Improve current ongoing analyses on segmentation, churn, and customer base propensities by researching new analysis methods and implementing them for optimal performance.‚Ä¢ Research and analyze new ideas to optimize our customer studies and processes.‚Ä¢ Actively collaborate with various stakeholders to translate complex insights into concrete recommendations for retail teams and ensure alignment with business strategies.‚Ä¢ Monitor marketing campaign performance and provide recommendations to optimize their effectiveness and define and monitor actions on the customer base to increase its value and loyalty, optimizing business margins in line with company targets.

Minimum qualifications needed for this role are:‚Ä¢ Excellent knowledge of data analysis techniques and at least one programming language (e.g. Python) and SQL to extract value from data.‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Excel and BI tools (Power BI) to effectively visualize and communicate business insights.‚Ä¢ Ability to set up a business case to evaluate the return of an action on a set of customers and their value evolution over ‚Ä¢ Ability to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring effective and inclusive communication.‚Ä¢ Ability to translate complex insights into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations, tailoring the message to the target audience.‚Ä¢ Ability to tackle challenges related to data quality, analysis, and technical difficulties, finding innovative and pragmatic solutions.‚Ä¢ Curiosity and continuous learning.‚Ä¢ Ability to critically evaluate data, identify biases, and ensure reliable and robust insights. ‚Ä¢ Communicate results clearly, simply, and effectively.‚Ä¢ Degree in an¬†economic or¬†quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or similar).‚Ä¢ A Ph.D. is considered a strong plus. ‚Ä¢ 4-8 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst or Data Scientist‚Ä¢ Experience in managing and analyzing pricing strategies, with a particular focus on margin dynamics, price setting, and churn management.‚Ä¢ Experience in managing data-driven projects on customer centricity.‚Ä¢ Advanced experience in Excel and BI and Data Visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).‚Ä¢ Advanced experience with SQL.‚Ä¢ Experience in scripting languages or statistical tools (Python, R, SPSS, ...) and major machine learning libraries is considered a strong plus.‚Ä¢ Experience with Git is considered a strong plus.Fluent English, speaking and writing
column2: Spanish is a great plus

4242956137,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-organizational-analyst-at-tim-4242956137?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=m6cRbbgSmW6x9YGQpxo3NA%3D%3D,DATA & ORGANIZATIONAL ANALYST,TIM,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Per una delle nostre Competence Development Area della sede di Roma ricerchiamo una persona con Laurea Magistrale in Economia, Statistica o Ingegneria Gestionale.

La persona si occuper√† di mappatura, analisi e reingegnerizzazione dei processi aziendali, revisione e formalizzazione della normativa interna, definizione dei modelli operativi di funzionamento, gestione della job architecture aziendale e delle job evaluation manageriali, supporto specialistico per i progetti strategici del Gruppo.
In particolare, tale attivit√† dovr√† essere svolta con riferimento al processo di integrazione delle competenze funzionali al percorso di trasformazione aziendale in atto.
Le competenze tecniche richieste sono le seguenti:
Conoscenza MS Office Excel, Word e Power Point

Alle persone interessate viene richiesta una seniority di almento due anni, oltre a spiccate capacit√† di relazione, negoziazione e comunicazione, proattivit√†, propensione a lavorare in team, capacit√† di problem solving, orientamento al risultato.
Costituiscono, infine, titoli preferenziali la conoscenza di PowerBI e di strumenti di Data Analysis, AI, SAP, Success Factor.
Offriamo un contratto di lavoro a tempo indeterminato e formazione continua, unitamente all‚Äôopportunit√† di lavorare in un contesto dinamico e strategico per il presidio dei processi di TIM.

4263441255,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-enel-x-4263441255?position=5&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=Lf51n7nme%2BFpCqm8akhhDw%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst,Enel X,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Description And Requirements
If you want to change the face of energy, we are looking for a ‚ÄúBusiness Data Analyst‚Äù to join our ‚ÄúCustomer Intelligence‚Äù team!

You will join the Customer Intelligence Team of Enel X Global Retail that is in charge of creating Advanced Analytics and providing actionable insights to drive business growth and optimize our marketing and sales strategies.
Develop and maintain an accurate and up-to-date data model to support business analyses and strategic decisions.
Analyze and interpret customer data to identify trends, behaviors, and market opportunities, such as predicting churn and identifying potential up-selling and cross-selling opportunities.
Improve current ongoing analyses on segmentation, churn, and customer base propensities by researching new analysis methods and implementing them for optimal performance.
Research and analyze new ideas to optimize our customer studies and processes.
Actively collaborate with various stakeholders to translate complex insights into concrete recommendations for retail teams and ensure alignment with business strategies.

Monitor marketing campaign performance and provide recommendations to optimize their effectiveness and define and monitor actions on the customer base to increase its value and loyalty, optimizing business margins in line with company targets.
Minimum qualifications needed for this role are:
Excellent knowledge of data analysis techniques and at least one programming language (e.g. Python) and SQL to extract value from data.
Advanced skills in Excel and BI tools (Power BI) to effectively visualize and communicate business insights.
Ability to set up a business case to evaluate the return of an action on a set of customers and their value evolution over
Ability to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring effective and inclusive communication.
Ability to translate complex insights into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations, tailoring the message to the target audience.
Ability to tackle challenges related to data quality, analysis, and technical difficulties, finding innovative and pragmatic solutions.
Ability to critically evaluate data, identify biases, and ensure reliable and robust insights.
Communicate results clearly, simply, and effectively.
Degree in an economic or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or similar).
A Ph.D. is considered a strong plus.
4-8 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst or Data Scientist
Experience in managing and analyzing pricing strategies, with a particular focus on margin dynamics, price setting, and churn management.
Experience in managing data-driven projects on customer centricity.
Advanced experience in Excel and BI and Data Visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
Experience in scripting languages or statistical tools (Python, R, SPSS, ...) and major machine learning libraries is considered a strong plus.
Experience with Git is considered a strong plus.

column2: Spanish is a great plus

column1: Health insurance and supplementary pension fund
Corporate welfare for better work-life balance (parenting support, daycare, extra parental leave etc‚Ä¶)
Benefits with dedicated offers and conventions (meal vouchers, travel, transport, sports, culture, energy etc...)
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Selection Process
This opportunity is open to all candidates, we care about everyone unicity since a diverse workforce is an innovation lever.

Our selection process is customized for each role and includes an interview with our recruiters and/or an attitudinal assessment and a meeting with our business line colleagues for a technical evaluation. If you are in line with the job description, the recruiting team will contact you, providing you with additional information about the recruiting process.
We are looking for people who embody our values: Trust, Respect, Innovation, Proactivity and Flexibility.
Are you ready to make a difference and grow with us? Apply now and join us in leading the energy transition within the Customer Intelligence team!

We‚Äôre a global leader in energy generation, distribution, and sales, as well as the largest private renewable energy operator, thanks to our wind, hydroelectric, photovoltaic, and geothermal plants.

We generate, deliver, and sell energy in 28 countries across Europe, the Americas, Africa, Asia, and Oceania, with an unwavering commitment to the development of territories, local communities, and customers.

We‚Äôre engaged in ensuring ever-more efficient, resilient, and digitalized electrical grids, with the highest service standards, by managing a network spanning 1.9 million kilometers and investing in storage systems to integrate renewable production, stabilize the electrical system, and allow for the management of the intermittency of renewable sources.

Innovation and sustainability are part of our Strategic Plan: we invest in new technology and new ways to develop and operate energy facilities, grids, and customer-focused services, fostering a more conscious energy use.

With an installed capacity of over 86 GW ‚Äì 62 GW of which from renewable sources - and 60 million worldwide customers, we work for a fair energy transition and a clean electrification process, thanks also to our reliable and accessible electric mobility services and a network of 26,200 public charging stations.
Curious about us? Explore here www.enel.com

Description And Requirements

If you want to change the face of energy, we are looking for a ‚ÄúBusiness Data Analyst‚Äù to join our ‚ÄúCustomer Intelligence‚Äù team!

Who You‚Äôll Work With

You will join the Customer Intelligence Team of Enel X Global Retail that is in charge of creating Advanced Analytics and providing actionable insights to drive business growth and optimize our marketing and sales strategies.

What You‚Äôll do

  • Develop and maintain an accurate and up-to-date data model to support business analyses and strategic decisions.
  • Analyze and interpret customer data to identify trends, behaviors, and market opportunities, such as predicting churn and identifying potential up-selling and cross-selling opportunities.
  • Improve current ongoing analyses on segmentation, churn, and customer base propensities by researching new analysis methods and implementing them for optimal performance.
  • Research and analyze new ideas to optimize our customer studies and processes.
  • Actively collaborate with various stakeholders to translate complex insights into concrete recommendations for retail teams and ensure alignment with business strategies.
  • Monitor marketing campaign performance and provide recommendations to optimize their effectiveness and define and monitor actions on the customer base to increase its value and loyalty, optimizing business margins in line with company targets.

What You‚Äôll Bring

Minimum qualifications needed for this role are:

  • Excellent knowledge of data analysis techniques and at least one programming language (e.g. Python) and SQL to extract value from data.
  • Advanced skills in Excel and BI tools (Power BI) to effectively visualize and communicate business insights.
  • Ability to set up a business case to evaluate the return of an action on a set of customers and their value evolution over
  • Ability to bridge the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring effective and inclusive communication.
  • Ability to translate complex insights into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations, tailoring the message to the target audience.
  • Ability to tackle challenges related to data quality, analysis, and technical difficulties, finding innovative and pragmatic solutions.
  • Curiosity and continuous learning.
  • Ability to critically evaluate data, identify biases, and ensure reliable and robust insights.
  • Communicate results clearly, simply, and effectively.
  • Degree in an economic or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, or similar).
  • A Ph.D. is considered a strong plus.
  • 4-8 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst or Data Scientist
  • Experience in managing and analyzing pricing strategies, with a particular focus on margin dynamics, price setting, and churn management.
  • Experience in managing data-driven projects on customer centricity.
  • Advanced experience in Excel and BI and Data Visualization tools (e.g., Power BI).
  • Advanced experience with SQL.
  • Experience in scripting languages or statistical tools (Python, R, SPSS, ...) and major machine learning libraries is considered a strong plus.
  • Experience with Git is considered a strong plus.

Fluent English, speaking and writing
column2:
Spanish is a great plus

  • Permanent employment contract

Who We Are

Enel Spa

We‚Äôre a global leader in energy generation, distribution, and sales, as well as the largest private renewable energy operator, thanks to our wind, hydroelectric, photovoltaic, and geothermal plants.

We generate, deliver, and sell energy in 28 countries across Europe, the Americas, Africa, Asia, and Oceania, with an unwavering commitment to the development of territories, local communities, and customers.

Innovation and sustainability are part of our Strategic Plan: we invest in new technology and new ways to develop and operate energy facilities, grids, and customer-focused services, fostering a more conscious energy use.

With an installed capacity of over 86 GW ‚Äì 62 GW of which from renewable sources - and 60 million worldwide customers, we work for a fair energy transition and a clean electrification process, thanks also to our reliable and accessible electric mobility services and a network of 26,200 public charging stations.

4240143422,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-msx-international-4240143422?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=E6ObgH7l3B8ZfcHONXBqzA%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst,MSX International,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Company Description
With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:
Building trust since 1931, our proven track record means that we now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.
To empower Movers and Makers to thrive in our ever-changing world
To harness our expertise in mobility, the creativity of our global teams,
and the power of technology, to craft tailored and innovative solutions
To enhance every journey in the world of mobility
Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!
MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:
3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and contribute to our company‚Äôs success, apply now!

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.
In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy
You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

    Job Description

    Business Data Analyst

    40 hours per week, Monday-Friday

    Rome, hybrid

    Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!

    MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

    The Role

    Responsibilities

    As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:

    • Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
    • Provide data-driven recommendations to stakeholder
    • Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences

    Qualifications

    About you

    About

    We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:

    • 3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
    • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
    • Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
    • Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
    • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
    • Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
    • Fluent level of English

    If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and contribute to our company‚Äôs success, apply now!

    What‚Äôs in it for you?

    At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.

    In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy

    • Competitive salary
    • Company laptop and phone
    • Lunch voucher

    Working Pattern

    • 40 hours per week
    • Monday ‚Äì Friday
    • Rome - hybrid

    You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

    Additional Information

    MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.
Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse.
La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti dell'ingegneria dei dati, con un forte focus sulla progettazione delle informazioni e visualizzazione dei dati. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Disegno di basi dati con finalit√† analitiche
Analisi e integrazione di fonti dati
Analisi, progettazione e implementazione di reporting e cruscotti di monitoraggio
Analisi dei processi di business e disegno di modelli analitici a supporto
Implementazione di soluzioni analitiche, supporto al go-live e application maintenance.
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica
Hai sviluppato conoscenza in ambito dati e database (modelli dati entit√†/relazioni, DBMS)
Hai sviluppato interesse per l'ambito Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics
Hai sviluppato la capacit√† di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati
Hai maturato onoscenza di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Qlik, Power BI, Tableau o equivalenti.
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL
column2: la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.

column1: Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†
At KPMG - no secrets with big data
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.
Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.
Specifically, you will be tasked with:
Analyzing, designing, and implementing reporting and monitoring dashboards
Analyzing business processes and designing analytical models to support them
Implementing analytical solutions, go-live support, and application maintenance.
Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics
This is the perfect opportunity for you if:
You have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management engineering, or computer science.
You have developed knowledge in the field of data and databases (entity/relationship data models, DBMS).
You have developed an interest in the field of Business Intelligence/Data & Analytics.
You have developed the ability to combine business skills with IT skills, including data modeling
You have a good command of English, preferably with experience studying and/or working abroad
You have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL
column2: knowledge of programming languages is an advantage.

column1: Your Future With Us - What you‚Äôll find at KPMG

Together for Better ‚Äì Our values and commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect every individual, continuous learning, transparency, commitment to the community and integrity. These are the KPMG values that create an environment that encourages the sharing of ideas and knowledge, so our professionals can achieve their full potential.

AAs a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarised all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy.

The role of the Data Analyst requires the maintenance and integration of both static and dynamic data related to equity securities listed on global stock exchanges and of related Entities, including all possible corporate actions and the types of dividends distributed.

This role calls for accuracy and a solid understanding of all types of equity or capital-participation financial instruments. Additionally, knowledge of national and international taxation related to the financial securities under analysis is required. The analyst is also responsible for managing the entity database, ensuring proper codification and the corporate group structure. A proactive attitude towards client interaction, strong problem-solving skills and teamwork abilities are also essential for this role.
Track all life cycle events of financial instruments (such as dividends, corporate actions, etc.) for the full set of securities listed on designated stock exchanges.
Collect company and security data requested by clients, ensure complete coverage of corporate groups, and monitor Initial Public Offerings (IPOs)
Acquire financial data for issuers and securities from relevant markets
Manage both ordinary and extraordinary corporate actions involving issuers.
Interact occasionally with companies (e.g., investor relations) to acquire and update corporate information
Deliver client support via the help desk, assisting with the content monitored and implemented within internal systems
Analyze, monitor, and maintain specific tax-related content concerning the securities under review
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in an economic field
Experience in the financial services industry would be an asset
Strong collaboration skills - ability to navigate cross functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
Must have the ability to develop strong relationships with colleagues at all levels of the organization
Understanding of how data is stored and flows through systems and databases
Proficiency in English and Italian (spoken and written)
Experience in querying and retrieving data from structured databases (e.g. SQL) and in using programming languages such as Python

Job Description

Job Purpose

The role of the Data Analyst requires the maintenance and integration of both static and dynamic data related to equity securities listed on global stock exchanges and of related Entities, including all possible corporate actions and the types of dividends distributed.

This role calls for accuracy and a solid understanding of all types of equity or capital-participation financial instruments. Additionally, knowledge of national and international taxation related to the financial securities under analysis is required. The analyst is also responsible for managing the entity database, ensuring proper codification and the corporate group structure. A proactive attitude towards client interaction, strong problem-solving skills and teamwork abilities are also essential for this role.

Responsibilities

  • Track all life cycle events of financial instruments (such as dividends, corporate actions, etc.) for the full set of securities listed on designated stock exchanges.
  • Collect company and security data requested by clients, ensure complete coverage of corporate groups, and monitor Initial Public Offerings (IPOs)
  • Acquire financial data for issuers and securities from relevant markets
  • Manage both ordinary and extraordinary corporate actions involving issuers.
  • Interact occasionally with companies (e.g., investor relations) to acquire and update corporate information
  • Deliver client support via the help desk, assisting with the content monitored and implemented within internal systems
  • Analyze, monitor, and maintain specific tax-related content concerning the securities under review

Knowledge And Experience

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in an economic field
  • Experience in the financial services industry would be an asset
  • Strong collaboration skills - ability to navigate cross functional teams to deliver on shared objectives
  • Must have the ability to develop strong relationships with colleagues at all levels of the organization
  • Understanding of how data is stored and flows through systems and databases
  • Proficiency in English and Italian (spoken and written)
  • Experience in querying and retrieving data from structured databases (e.g. SQL) and in using programming languages such as Python

Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.
Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.
La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven
Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali
Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend.

Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in Data Science, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Statistica o altra ritenuta attinente
Hai una buona conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione come Python e SAS
Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud
Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati
Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly
Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS)
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.
Lighthouse is KPMG Advisory's center of excellence offering Data & Analytics solutions in the market.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. You will work in a technology innovation-oriented environment, dealing with Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing and more! We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.
Specifically, you will be involved in:
Data Integration: understanding which data sources are important and how they should be treated in order to enhance new Data Driven tools and methodologies
Modeling: developing new Machine Learning models ad hoc to meet business demands and requirements
Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines from data ingestion to frontend applications.
Business-oriented meetings and events: Strong focus on sharing project details with business users builds confidence in the tool and the methodology used to develop it
Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics.
This opportunity is perfect for you if:
You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics or other deemed relevant
You have a good understanding of major programming languages such as Python and SAS
You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure
You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation
You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly
You have basic skills with major cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)
You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad
Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.
An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
Advanced training and development programs to stay current
Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being
Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network risulta conforme agli standard dei requisiti ISO 30415, sul Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, relativa alla parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

Unisciti a noi!

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.

Lighthouse is KPMG Advisory's center of excellence offering Data &
column13:
Analytics solutions in the market.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. You will work in a technology innovation-oriented environment, dealing with Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing and more! We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.

Specifically, you will be involved in:

  • Data Integration: understanding which data sources are important and how they should be treated in order to enhance new Data Driven tools and methodologies
column14: • Modeling: developing new Machine Learning models ad hoc to meet business demands and requirements
column15:
• Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines from data ingestion to frontend applications.
  • Business-oriented meetings and events: Strong focus on sharing project details with business users builds confidence in the tool and the methodology used to develop it
column16:
Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics.

This opportunity is perfect for you if:

  • You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics or other deemed relevant
column17: • You have a good understanding of major programming languages such as Python and SAS
column18: • You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure
column19: • You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation
column20: • You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly
column21: • You have basic skills with major cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)
column22: • You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad
column23:
Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.

  • An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
  • A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
  • Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
  • Advanced training and development programs to stay current
  • International mindset and innovative projects
  • Initiatives focused on mental and physical well-being

Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network complies with the standards of the ISO 30415 requirements, on the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, relating to gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Join us!

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

4234279975,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/aml-data-analyst-intern-at-worldline-4234279975?position=18&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=hgDnoqz2Jw%2FzoygBFThLDQ%3D%3D,AML Data Analyst Intern,Worldline,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Job Description

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

Join a dynamic team dedicated to support the growth in full compliance with Worldline‚Äôs merchant risk policies safeguarding our financial forefront, where every day offers the chance to make an impact in the fight against money laundering and terrorism financing. We are seeking a AML Data Analyst Intern to join our team, reporting to the Head of First Line of Defense Risk and Compliance at Worldline Merchant Services Italia. Your role will play a crucial role in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support business decision-making, to streamline operations and ensure compliance with the company's standards.

Reporting KYC: Gather data needed for AML KYC purposes from different business sources and prepare monthly reports detailing KYC information, ensuring weekly updates to reflect current review status in monthly committees

Reporting Internal Committee: Compile data related to KYC, Credit, and Fraud activities into an annual report file including statistics and updates from involved departments (Compliance, Operations, AML) on periodic basis
Reporting Business Information KPIs: Analyze Business Information KPIs in onboarding and ongoing merchant activities
column2: Identify consumption trends or changes, highlighting concerns or improvement opportunities in relation to contractual consumption caps

column1: Preparation of Functional Analysis Files for IT Implementations: Support internal Project Managers in the collaboration with Compliance, Operations, Information Technology to collect and document business requirements for different IT Implementation.
We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what‚Äôs next ‚Äì people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:
Master's degree in Economics, Management, or Law
Familiarity with data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R)
Strong critical thinking, analytical, and organizational skills
Basic knowledge of KYC and AML processes as a plus
Good level of English in speaking and writing.

Job Description

AML Data Analyst Intern

AML Data Analyst Intern

Rome, Italy

This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

The Opportunity

Join a dynamic team dedicated to support the growth in full compliance with Worldline‚Äôs merchant risk policies safeguarding our financial forefront, where every day offers the chance to make an impact in the fight against money laundering and terrorism financing. We are seeking a AML Data Analyst Intern to join our team, reporting to the Head of First Line of Defense Risk and Compliance at Worldline Merchant Services Italia. Your role will play a crucial role in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support business decision-making, to streamline operations and ensure compliance with the company's standards.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities

  • Reporting KYC: Gather data needed for AML KYC purposes from different business sources and prepare monthly reports detailing KYC information, ensuring weekly updates to reflect current review status in monthly committees
column2: • Reporting Internal Committee: Compile data related to KYC, Credit, and Fraud activities into an annual report file including statistics and updates from involved departments (Compliance, Operations, AML) on periodic basis
column3: • Reporting Business Information KPIs: Analyze Business Information KPIs in onboarding and ongoing merchant activities
column4: Identify consumption trends or changes, highlighting concerns or improvement opportunities in relation to contractual consumption caps
column5:
• Preparation of Functional Analysis Files for IT Implementations: Support internal Project Managers in the collaboration with Compliance, Operations, Information Technology to collect and document business requirements for different IT Implementation.

    • Who Are We Looking For

    We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what‚Äôs next ‚Äì people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:

    • Master's degree in Economics, Management, or Law
column6: • Familiarity with data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R)
column7: • Strong critical thinking, analytical, and organizational skills
column8: • Excellent communication skills
column9: • Basic knowledge of KYC and AML processes as a plus
column10:
• Good level of English in speaking and writing.

Do you have a passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision and the media landscape? An ambition to drive the change through deep consumer understanding and advanced analytics is also what we are looking for!
If so, then this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it and how we can we influence them through immersive exploration and big data analytics. We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.
A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.
As An Intern In Analytics And Insights, You Will
Act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G Top management in several business domains (consumer, customer, digital etc.)
Be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth
Combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions

Grow your skills continuously, improving your mastery in big data analytics, as well as immersive in-depth researches. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal and external guides worldwide.
Responsibilities as of Day 1 ‚Äì You will be given specific projects and responsibilities working on real and live business challenges, just like a true P&Ger
Continuous coaching ‚Äì You will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager
Dynamic and respectful work environment ‚Äì Employees are at the core, we value every individual and encourage initiatives, promoting work/life balance
Compensation & Benefits: you will receive a competitive internship salary as well as other benefits whilst you are with us.
Just apply online via clicking the button below
Attach any documents you consider relevant: motivation letter, recommendations, certificates etc.
Master students or recent graduates with strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Boundless curiosity and the passion to generate results
Data Analytics background represents a plus
Have creativity, innovation, initiative and follow-through with your goals, along with strong written and verbal communication skills
Are fluent in Italian and have an excellent ability to communicate in English
Are available for a minimum of 3 months, preferably 6 months internship.

KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†
At KPMG - no secrets with big data
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.
Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.
Specifically, you will be tasked with:
data visualization , advanced analytics, Big Data
designing more efficient KPIs and computing frameworks
analysing, designing and implementing reporting models and dashboards
analysing corporate processes and designing analytical support models
implementing analytical solutions, supporting the launch and overseeing the maintenance of software.
Come As You Are - Your skills and characteristics
This is the perfect opportunity for you if:
you have a degree in economics, mathematics, mathematical engineering, statistics, computer engineering, management and production engineering or computer science
you have developed the capacity to combine corporate and IT expertise, as well as data modelling
you have developed aninterest in Data Visualization/Business Intelligence
you are proficient in English, preferably with study/work experience abroad
you have knowledge of at least one of the following databases (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) and have developed skills in SQL
column2: knowledge of programming languages is considered an advantage.

4074546905,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analytics-engineer-at-immobiliare-it-4074546905?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=ZtsJwvPrxsdUKYgVna%2FK1g%3D%3D,Junior Data Analytics Engineer,Immobiliare.it,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Immobiliare.it S.p.A. is an Italian group composed of companies specializing in Digital Tech services for the sale and rental of real estate, aimed at individuals, real estate professionals, banking institutions and financial sector operators.

Founded in 2005, Immobiliare.it, the No. 1 real estate portal in Italy, has expanded its offering with specialized portals such as Trovacasa.it, MioAffitto and LuxuryEstate.com, dedicated to luxury properties.

Immobiliare.it Insights, the company's proptech division, offers digital advisory, insights and data diligence services to banks, investors and appraisers. A leading player in Italy in the mortgage sector, the group includes Immobiliare.it Mutui, specializing in remote credit brokerage, Euroansa with a network of over 800 credit brokers throughout the country and Genio Diligence, a company focused on credit risk and fraud prevention for brokers and financial institutions. The group is also present in foreign markets in Spain (Pisos.com, Indomio.es and Enalquiler.com), Greece (Spitogatos.gr, Indomio.gr), Slovenia (Nekretnine.net) and Croatia (Crozilla.com and Indomio.hr).
We are looking for a Junior Data Analytics Engineer to join our Marketing team.
marketing analytics: measurement of marketing campaigns with a focus on causality, optimization and data-driven decision-making
data management and architecture: data warehousing and big data analytics using cloud technologies (GCP, AWS) and open-source tools (Airflow, dataform, dbt)
data pipelines: design and manage reliable marketing data pipelines to provide new insights and detect threats and opportunities

data products: build end-to-end marketing data products combining internal data with several external sources like market and industry trends (e.g. market data, Google searches, online research) and competitive intelligence tools (e.g. Similarweb, data.ai, Semrush).
new graduate in Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Physics
analytical mindset with a problem solving approach
curious and passionate about marketing and tech platforms
fluent in English and working knowledge of Italian.
Our team is responsible for all marketing activities of our Group: Immobiliare.it (Italy), Indomio.es (Spain), Immotop.lu (Luxembourg), Crozilla.com (Croatia) and LuxuryEstate (Global)

performance marketing: we design, create and manage campaigns with different business objectives (e.g. user acquisition and engagement, lead generation and brand awareness). We are one of the top advertisers in our markets, we collaborate with the best partners and our strong relationship with them allow us to develop ad-hoc projects and to access new features, products and technologies before they‚Äôre widely released

analytics: Our products generate hundreds of millions of events every day, by analysing these interactions we can learn about our customers and their experience, optimise marketing investments, uncover new opportunities, and support data-driven decision-making.

market and competitor insights: we study the real estate market and our industry to uncover emerging trends, discover business opportunities and forecast demand as accurately as possible to stay ahead of the curve
projects: we drive growth, operational and technological improvements working cross-team and cross-competence (Tech, Product, Sales, PR & Content teams).
a young and dynamic work environment
an opportunity in a fast-growing company
paid internship contract or fixed contract
free coffee and fresh fruit every day
break room with a foosball table
office located in the centre of Rome (Termini).
This announcement is addressed to people of any sex, pursuant to laws 903/77 and 125/91, and to people of all ages and all nationalities, pursuant to legislative decrees 215/03 and 216/03.

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise. You will combine IT, mathematics, statistics and business knowledge to create predictive analyses, which you will present and communicate in a professional and skilful manner. You will work in a technology-driven environment, focusing on the development of end-to-end Artificial Intelligence solutions, with particular emphasis on the application of Large Language Models and AI Agents. We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and analyze data.
Specifically, within a structured team, you will deal with:

Validating the implemented solution with business experts
Analyzing, designing, and implementing monitoring tools for the developed solutions
Supporting the launch and managing the maintenance of the applications.

You have a basic understanding of major Artificial Intelligence solutions
You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad.

The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.

The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.

As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.
Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications.
Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights.

Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders.
Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes.
Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories.
Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization.
Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies.
Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods.
Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects.
Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives.
Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role.
Proficiency in Python and R programming languages.
Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI.
Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced.
Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance.
Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail
Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend.
Fluency in English and Italian are a mus
LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person‚Äôs singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent

Position

Data Scientist

Job Responsibilities

The position is based in our HQ in Rome and part of the Global team.

The Data Scientist's mission is to empower Fendi with data-driven insights that fuel strategic decision-making, enhance customer understanding, and drive business growth. By leveraging analytical expertise and a deep understanding of the business, the Data Scientist's will identify opportunities for optimization, improve operational efficiency, and contribute to Fendi's continued success in the luxury fashion market.

As part of the LVMH Group, this role also involves collaborating and interfacing with other entities within the group, providing a broader perspective and exposure to a diverse range of business challenges and opportunities.

Main Responsibilities

  • Proficiency in machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms with a strong understanding of their practical applications.
  • Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models to address complex business challenges, optimize operational efficiency, and deliver actionable strategic insights.
  • Expertise in analyzing large, diverse datasets using advanced statistical and AI techniques to identify key trends, patterns, and correlations, transforming these insights into clear, data-driven recommendations for business stakeholders.
  • Proven experience working with customer and sales data, particularly within a retail/consumer environment, to drive targeted business outcomes.
  • Expertise in data collection, cleansing, and comprehensive analysis of large datasets from various sources, including customer, sales, and operational data repositories.
  • Conduct ad-hoc data analysis to address specific business inquiries and support informed decision-making processes across the organization.
  • Measure the impact and effectiveness of strategic initiatives and marketing campaigns using appropriate metrics and rigorous statistical methodologies.
  • Measure the results of initiatives and campaigns using appropriate metrics and statistical methods.
  • Collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into clear, well-defined data analysis projects.
  • Communicate complex findings, insights, and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences in a clear, concise, and persuasive manner.
  • Actively participate in cross-functional projects, providing data-driven insights and support for key business initiatives.
  • Manage relationships with data vendors, ensuring service level agreements (SLAs) are met and data quality is maintained.

Profile

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
  • 3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role.
  • Proficiency in Python and R programming languages.
  • Experience with data visualization tools, mainly Power BI.
  • Preferably experience with Dataiku.
  • Strong SQL skills and experience with relational databases.
  • Familiarity with cloud computing platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • Knowledge of statistical modelling techniques. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team and perform under pressure in a fast-paced.
  • Evidence of successful delivery of data driven analysis and recommendations to drive forward business performance.
  • Critical thinking and attention to detail, extremely organized and high attention to luxury and detail
  • Demonstrated interest in keeping up with emerging technologies and the data trend.
  • Fluency in English and Italian are a mus

Additional Information

LVMH is committed to non-discrimination and respect of each person‚Äôs singularities. We recognize and recruit all types of talent

Data Scientist, Data Governance expert, Data Architect, Data Project Manager).
