As the country‚Äôs leading digital health platform, our goal is clear: helping people live longer, healthier lives. We're part of Docplanner, a global health tech unicorn operating in 13 countries and backed by top investors like Goldman Sachs and One Peak Partners.
We're growing fast, and we're looking for curious, driven, data-passionate people to join us on this journey.

We're on the hunt for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our vibrant BI team. You‚Äôll be the connection point between raw data and smart decisions , empowering teams across the company with the insights they need to make an impact. If you love transforming complexity into clarity and collaborating with people from all corners of the business, this role is for you.
Turn data into insight: Identify patterns, trends, and business opportunities through reporting and storytelling.
Support decision-making: Help product, marketing, customer success, finance, HR and other teams understand performance and make data-backed choices.
Ensure data quality: Monitor KPIs, spot inconsistencies, and work with teams to fix issues at the source.
Build scalable solutions: Automate dashboards and reports that drive alignment and visibility across departments.
Collaborate and connect: Act as the go-to person for BI support, guiding stakeholders through their data needs and solutions.
SQL (Redshift), Tableau, Superset, Airflow, Git, Excel, PowerPoint, HubSpot, Amplitude, Looker Studio and possibly Python/R if you're ready to explore more advanced analysis.
We‚Äôre not just looking for someone who can crunch numbers, we‚Äôre looking for someone who‚Äôs curious, proactive, and wants to make an impact.
Here‚Äôs what will help you thrive in this role:
You‚Äôve got 2‚Äì4 years of experience in business analysis, BI, or data roles.
You're comfortable writing SQL queries to answer real business questions.
You know your way around a BI tool (Bonus point: Superset).
You're detail-oriented, but also love seeing the big picture.
You enjoy talking to people and helping them turn ‚ÄúI think‚Äù into ‚ÄúI know‚Äù.
You‚Äôre fluent in English and Italian. You like working in an international, collaborative environment.
Willing to be relocated in Rome

Extra brownie points if you‚Äôve dabbled with Python or R, have worked with CRMs like HubSpot or Salesforce, or have experience with tools like Amplitude or Segment. But don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì none of these are must-haves.
Because here, you‚Äôre not just a number-cruncher , you‚Äôre a partner in making healthcare better.
üß† Real impact: Your insights will help thousands of doctors and millions of patients.
üåç Global vibes: Join an international team, but make a difference locally.
üöÄ Ownership from day one: Your work won‚Äôt sit in a drawer. It‚Äôll drive action fast.
üí° Growth mindset: Whether it‚Äôs learning new tools or owning bigger projects, we‚Äôll help you grow.
‚ù§Ô∏è People-first culture: We care about results, but we care about each other even more.
üí∂ Competitive salary adequate to your experience and skills
üìà Share options plan after 6 months working with us.

DXC Technology is looking for Analytics Business Analyst to join Analytics DXC Offering.

DXC Analytics is focused on providing customers innovative solutions and high added value, in the following areas: Analytics Solutions and Services, Big Data Platforms, Information Governance, Business Intelligence & Data Management, Artificial Intelligence and IoT Analytics.

Consolidated - at least 5 years - professional experience on BI/DWH projects
Strong Experience on Data Modeling and on Advanced SQL
Attitude to modelling and understanding of the data and the client‚Äôs business
Nice to have: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in one of the following areas: Computer Science, Computer engineering, Mathematical Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Knowledge of Public Sector.

Being part of an highly-qualified team of 200 professionals with solid experience on Analytics Solutions and Services, Big Data Platforms, Information Governance, Business Intelligence & Data Management, Artificial Intelligence and IoT Analytics

From the first day, you will face with a reality that operates in more than 70 countries and formed through on the job training, technical training and soft skills, working inside a meritocratic reward system.

Thanks for taking the time to review our job, if you think it is a match to your experience and interests please apply today with CV in English - we are eager to learn more about you! If you know a friend who may be a fit for the job please refer them.
Location: Rome (RM) with remote work possibility

At DXC Technology, we believe strong connections and community are key to our success. Our work model prioritizes in-person collaboration while offering flexibility to support wellbeing, productivity, individual work styles, and life circumstances. We‚Äôre committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive.

Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. More information on employment scams is available here.

    At DXC Technology, we believe strong connections and community are key to our success. Our work model prioritizes in-person collaboration while offering flexibility to support wellbeing, productivity, individual work styles, and life circumstances. We‚Äôre committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive.

    Recruitment fraud is a scheme in which fictitious job opportunities are offered to job seekers typically through online services, such as false websites, or through unsolicited emails claiming to be from the company. These emails may request recipients to provide personal information or to make payments as part of their illegitimate recruiting process. DXC does not make offers of employment via social media networks and DXC never asks for any money or payments from applicants at any point in the recruitment process, nor ask a job seeker to purchase IT or other equipment on our behalf. More information on employment scams is available here.

Il Gruppo Aeroporti di Roma, nell‚Äôambito della Business Unit Aviation nell‚Äôunit√† Operation & Maintenance, in particolare nell‚Äôasset ‚ÄúO&M and IoT Data Engineering, Environmental Operations‚Äù √® alla ricerca di:

L‚Äôasset O&M and IoT Data Engineering, Environmental Operations si occupa principalmente di garantire la progettazione, l‚Äôimplementazione e l‚Äôintegrazione di soluzioni IoT per la gestione degli asset, ingegnerizzando e analizzando i dati al fine di abilitare l‚Äôevoluzione della strategia manutentiva degli asset in ottica di value for money.

La risorsa avr√† maturato un‚Äôesperienza di 3 ‚Äì 5 anni in area automation presso realt√† industriali preferibilmente del settore trasporti/alimentare/beverage/pharma/automotive o presso societ√† impiantistiche costruttrici.

Collaborare alla progettazione e allo sviluppo di nuove funzionalit√† di piattaforme di monitoraggio/SCADA di asset e impianti aeroportuali, automatizzando il processo di gestione dei dati e definendo la tipologia di dati da monitorare

Definire e implementare le politiche di data governance, tra cui la definizione di standard di qualit√† dei dati e le linee guida di storicizzazione
Collaborare con i team di data science, data analysis e altri stakeholder aziendali per comprendere le esigenze di dati utili a sviluppare modelli di Machine Learning/AI.
Conoscenza pratica di PLC, DCS, SCADA, MES e problematiche relative allo scambio di segnali tra differenti sistemi di automazione
Esperienza con protocolli IoT: LoRaWAN, Zigbee, MQTT, OPC-UA per gestione e trasmissione dati sensoriali
Esperienza con protocolli di comunicazione industriale: PROFINET, PROFIBUS, KNX, BACnet, Modbus, Ethernet/IP, CANopen, EtherCAT
Esperienza con sensori e trasduttori per acquisizione dati (temperatura, umidit√†, pressione, accelerometri, giroscopi, vibrazionali, celle di carico, rogowski, sensori RFID/NFC)
Conoscenza di calibrazione, condizionamento segnali e interfacciamento con sistemi di acquisizione dati

Esperienza in process control, automazione, comunicazione machine-to-machine, machine-to-system e soluzioni Internet of Things (IOT)
Comprensione delle strutture dati, della modellazione dei dati e dell'architettura software
Conoscenza dei linguaggi di programmazione C, C++, VB.NET, SQL, Python
Esperienza con i flussi di lavoro basati sui dati (importazione, pulizia, funzionalit√†)
Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria dell‚Äôautomazione, Ingegneria informatica, Ingegneria elettronica, Ingegneria elettrica.

Sar√† considerato titolo preferenziale l‚Äôaver partecipato ad un master/corso di formazione in AI, Machine Learning, con particolare focus sull'integrazione delle tecnologie IoT nei processi di automazione e nella gestione dei sistemi industriali intelligenti, inclusi i sistemi di monitoraggio e controllo avanzato.

4270692196,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-lottomatica-4270692196?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=TeuDiZs5eZOYuA35abLpMw%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Lottomatica,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attivit√†: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualit√†, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilit√† e la sostenibilit√† al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica √® molto pi√π che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.
Siamo alla ricerca di un profilo che entrer√† a far parte del Dipartimento Operations & Technology come Data Scientist.
Disegnare, progettare, implementare e documentare nuove soluzioni AI a supporto dei processi aziendali.
Contribuire allo sviluppo e all‚Äôevoluzione della Data Platform in relazione ad aspetti tecnologici, organizzativi e di processo.
Contribuire alla crescita del patrimonio dati aziendale.
Collaborare con gli altri membri del team al fine di promuovere una cultura organizzativa di gruppo improntata su principi di solidariet√†, pragmaticit√†, efficacia e affiatamento.
Manutenzione, sviluppo ed evoluzione dei modelli attualmente in produzione, assumendone la gestione completa in collaborazione con il team.
Progettazione, implementazione, industrializzazione, manutenzione e monitoraggio di pipeline di machine learning e agenti virtuali in grado di supportare la trasformazione dei processi aziendali.
Relazione diretta col cliente interno per la valutazione dei risultati e la raccolta dei requisiti evolutivi.
Laurea o diploma in ambito scientifico/informatico/statistico o comprovata esperienza nell‚Äôelaborazione di dati e nell‚Äôapplicazione di modelli statistici/matematici/Machine Learning.
Conoscenza approfondita di algoritmi di Machine Learning e AI (LLM, modelli ad albero, NLP, clustering, neural network, time series, etc).
Conoscenza dei meccanicismi di analisi e preprocessing dei dati e feature engineering per progetti di Machine Learning (streaming e batch).

Capacit√† di coding e debugging in Pyspark e Python e quindi conoscenza delle principali librerie e frameworks di Machine Learning, soprattutto Spark e MLib, poi MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn‚Ä¶
Competenze in modellazione dati, modellazione di esperimenti statistici e conoscenza metodi quantitativi in generale.
Esperienza comprovata nel progettare, implementare e industrializzare soluzioni AI integrate.
Capacit√† di analisi di problemi di business, dati e contesto. Capacit√† di effettuare test delle ipotesi, comparazione di modelli, interpretazione e validazione dei risultati.
Git per il versioning del codice e rudimenti di devops
Opportunit√† di lavorare nella pi√π grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle pi√π grandi al mondo
Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove
Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti
Possibilit√† di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalit√† e responsabilit√† attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica
Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversit√†, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri
Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG
Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunit√† di lavoro ibrido
Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills

Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunit√† e promuove diversit√† e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione. In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo. Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinch√© il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, et√†, etnia, nazionalit√†, disabilit√†, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.

We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.
We are looking for a profile to join the Operations & Technology Department as Data Scientist.
‚Ä¢ Design, engineer, implement, and document new AI solutions to support business processes.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the development and evolution of the Data Platform in terms of technological, organizational, and process aspects.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the growth of the company's data assets.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with other team members to foster a group organizational culture based on principles of solidarity, pragmatism, effectiveness, and teamwork.
‚Ä¢ Maintain, develop, and evolve models currently in production, assuming full management in collaboration with the team.
‚Ä¢ Design, implementation, industrialization, maintenance, and monitoring of machine learning pipelines and virtual agents capable of supporting the transformation of business processes.
‚Ä¢ Direct contact with internal customers to evaluate results and gather development requirements.
‚Ä¢ Degree or diploma in science/computer science/statistics, or proven experience in data processing and the application of statistical/mathematical/machine learning models.
‚Ä¢ In-depth knowledge of machine learning and AI algorithms (LLM, tree models, NLP, clustering, neural networks, time series, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of data analysis and preprocessing mechanisms and feature engineering for machine learning projects (streaming and batch).

‚Ä¢ Coding and debugging skills in Pyspark and Python, and therefore knowledge of the main machine learning libraries and frameworks, especially Spark and MLib, as well as MLflow, Dataframe, PyTorch, TensorFlow, Numpy, Pandas, ScikitLearn, etc.
‚Ä¢ Expertise in data modeling, statistical experiment modeling, and general knowledge of quantitative methods.
‚Ä¢ Proven experience designing, implementing, and industrializing integrated AI solutions.
‚Ä¢ Ability to analyze business problems, data, and context. Ability to perform hypothesis testing, model comparison, and result interpretation and validation.
‚Ä¢ Git for code versioning and basic devops
What you will find in Lottomatica:
Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world
Work in a very dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment
Permanent contract and hybrid job opportunities
Ongoing training on hard skills and soft skills
Gross annual salary commensurate with experience from 43K.

Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination. At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment. We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

4264704255,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-engie-italia-4264704255?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=CKgzcWm40tdLvan5r1j%2Ftg%3D%3D,Data Engineer,ENGIE Italia,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Energy Management (EM) is responsible for the management of the ENGIE Group's assets, ensuring competitive energy for customers while optimizing created value, within a consistent risk framework.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its Global Business Unit Supply & Energy Management (S&EM) who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

15,000 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our +120,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.
At GEM we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.
More info on GEM Hub (https://gems.engie.com) or LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions).

EM IS team provides new solutions or system integration and support to simplify and automize the business‚Äô daily activities. We have a multi cloud platform, with all the applications and classic DWH projects are hosted as a PaaS architecture in Azure while there is a data lake hosted in AWS and several Machine learning projects are being migrated in this platform.
Based on its perimeter defined by IS Cloud & Data Science Manager, the candidate will learn have the following responsibilities:
Analyze and manage large volumes of data using SQL and data engineering tools.
Implement and scale solutions on AWS cloud for model training and inference.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to support strategic decisions.
Collaborate with internal teams and stakeholders to understand business needs and propose data-driven solutions.
Integrate models with external systems through the development or use of RESTful APIs.
Ensure data quality and robustness of developed models.
Develop and maintain data ingestion and ETL systems.
Develop and optimize machine learning models for time series forecasting in the energy sector.
The ideal profile matches with the followings prerequisites:
Bachelor's degree in STEM disciplines (Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, or related fields)
Excellent knowledge of Python and SQL for data analysis and modeling.
At least 2 years of experience in Data Science roles, with a focus on time series forecasting using Machine Learning and Deep Learning techniques.
Experience in developing and implementing solutions on AWS (e.g., Lambda, S3, SageMaker, Redshift, etc.).
Knowledge of energy market dynamics, with particular reference to spot markets and energy commodities.
Experience in developing reinforcement learning models for automated trading applications.
Experience with MLOps frameworks and CI/CD for model deployment.
The Data Engineer for EM strives to provide the highest possible quality of services such as the analysis, development and deployment of innovative solutions to the GEMS users.
Excellent command of written and spoken English for working in international contexts.
Interactive behavior: Active Listening and verbal and written communication skills.
Problem solving: Issues perception, analyzing, practical thinking, creativity, innovation.
Personal effectiveness: Facilitation skills, pragmatism and pro-activity, taking initiative.
Ability to communicate complex results to technical and non-technical stakeholders through dashboards and reports.
Local contract according to Italian labor law.

We rely on our key businesses (gas, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. 4195481260,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/director-analyst-master-data-management-mdm-remote-at-gartner-4195481260?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=Ry0RAe%2F7bEVJxh%2BADB7Qgg%3D%3D&trackingId=uvjtu2QvjMQoAX5V6MeTEw%3D%3D,"Director Analyst, Master Data Management (MDM), Remote",Gartner,"Rome, Latium, Italy","About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Director serves as a leader within Gartner‚Äôs Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner‚Äôs value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data & Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.
Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged ‚Äúmust-have research‚Äù content
Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client‚Äôs barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings

Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research & Advisory provide excellent service delivery
Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions
Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.

column1: You enjoy learning and being challenged intellectually on new topic areas or adjustments to previously held beliefs.
You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.
What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?
You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
You are always learning and looking to discover what‚Äôs next in technology.
You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients‚Äô biggest challenges.
At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?

Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. About the role:

Gartner Analysts are industry thought leaders who create must-have research, market predictions and best practices for a broad range of world-leading organizations. A Director serves as a leader within Gartner‚Äôs Research and Advisory sector, establishing oneself as a credible voice within their designated market at local, regional and global levels.

Utilizing exceptional research and analytical skills, a Senior Director plays a significant role in producing pragmatic and provocative research which Gartner clients consume and apply to propel their business toward key objectives. They are a trusted source of advice for clients, reinforcing Gartner‚Äôs value every day by engaging them via in-person meetings, virtual meetings, sales support visits and Gartner conferences to discuss complex client challenges and offer appropriate recommendations.

The successful candidate is a subject matter expert in Master Data Management (MDM) and understands its application across people, processes, and technologies. The candidate will focus on written and customer-facing deliverables to support Data &
column2:
Analytics Leaders who face the challenges of improving/establishing/reviving MDM initiatives. This role will require in depth knowledge of the MDM Market in addition to a strategic level understanding of the topic.

What you will do:

  • Create innovative, thought provoking, and highly leveraged ‚Äúmust-have research‚Äù content
  • Develop new research and ideas through thought leadership and offer compelling, actionable approaches to client's needs and requests that accelerate the client's ability to act
  • Develop in-depth analysis to identify the root cause of a client‚Äôs barriers or overall needs and reframe thinking to drive strategy forward
  • Demonstrate thought leadership in establishing research positions across a team of analysts
  • Bring provocative, independent insights to Gartner leaders that can evolve the course of a research agenda
  • Research, analyze and predict market trends and shifts to provide clients and vendors with actionable insights
  • Provide clients and prospects with actionable advice aligned to their designated content area via virtual or face-to-face interactions
  • Create and deliver high value presentation materials on and off stage for Gartner events, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings
  • Support Research and Sales: Provide sales support serving as voice of the market to help research teams create content and to drive engagement with clients to make progress against their critical priorities to grow their business
  • Provide high quality and timely research content peer review
  • Build credibility as an industry expert to represent Gartner research, methodology and strategy
  • Actively participate in innovation, ideation, and research discussions and collaborate effectively with peers in the research community
  • Identify research process improvements or develop new processes that help the team and Research &
column3:
Advisory provide excellent service delivery
  • Be a mentor and a coach by supporting more junior team members
  • Be client-centric while actively seeking to help clients engage regularly and often with Gartner research and interactions

    • What you will need:

    • Subject matter expertise, with demonstrated knowledge of Master Data Management (MDM) Strategy.
    • Deep understanding of the MDM market including (but not limited to): who the key players are, what core capabilities are required, the evolution of the market.
    • Detailed knowledge of one or more MDM Product(s), hands on experience of implementing an MDM solution is a plus.
    • Bachelor's Degree, Advanced Professional Qualification, or 10+ years direct experience in a field related to Data and Analytics.
    • Demonstrate executive presence
column4:
can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work under tight deadlines and produce high quality deliverables

ability to engage clients and respond effectively to questions

can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges

can effectively apply patterns and frameworks while drawing and defending conclusions to client challenges.

  • You are versatile and able to pivot to new topics to match the challenges faced by our clients.
  • You are a strong communicator who can explain complex concepts concisely and simply.
  • You are a subject matter expert who is comfortable presenting at large and small-scale speaking engagements.
  • You can demonstrate executive presence and can immediately establish credibility with executives and additional stakeholders.

    • What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?

    • You are a team player who values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage.
    • You are always learning and looking to discover what‚Äôs next in technology.
    • You pursue personal excellence through team collaboration and consensus.
    • You love to shape ideas and business-related recommendations to solve clients‚Äô biggest challenges.

    Who are we?

    At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.

    Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.

    Since our founding in 1979, we‚Äôve grown to more than 21,000 associates globally who support ~14,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That‚Äôs why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.

    What makes Gartner a great place to work?

    Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.

    We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.

    Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.

    We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.

    What do we offer?

    Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.

    In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive ‚Äî working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.

    Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.

Bulgari is looking for a talented BI Expert to join its Data & AI Product Unit within the Corporate IT in Rome. Reporting directly to the Chief Data & AI Officer you will be responsible to:
Design and implement innovative BI solutions on SAP S4 and SAP Datasphere, integrating data for a complete view of the business.
Create stunning reporting and solutions that will guide decisions based on strategic Business data.
Experiment with the latest SAP BI technologies, such as SAP Datasphere and SAP Business Data Cloud, to keep Bulgari at the forefront of BI Innovation.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure our data solutions are flawless, from delivery to operations.
Maintain & Evolve existing and new solutions.
A graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
A professional with at least 5 years of experience in Business Intelligence and Data Analysis.
A guru of S4 Embedded Analytics (CDS/VDM, AFO, Fiori) and SAP Datashpere.
A wizard of SQL/ABAP and data modeling techniques.
An effective communicator, capable of presenting complex data to a diverse audience.
A problem solver with a results-oriented approach.

A collaborative and agile team-member / team-leader able to put in place strong and effective collaborations with all the people involved in the many initiatives and projects she/he will be involved in.
A Business Intelligence technologist very interested in innovation and in learning new tools/platforms (e.g. PowerBI, Databricks, etc.) also sharing her/his knowledge within the team.
The opportunity to work for a multinational / multicultural brand leader in the luxury market.
A stimulating and dynamic work environment where innovation and collaboration is at the heart of everything.
The opportunity to grow professionally and make a tangible contribution to Bulgari's success.

4270952152,https://dk.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-product-manager-at-autorola-group-%C2%B7-global-4270952152?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=%2BBj5YDEpdDdlMGa2OjF2Cw%3D%3D&trackingId=EgWXJ3QEBTOwdzSLZQs81Q%3D%3D,AI Product Manager,Autorola Group ¬∑ Global,"Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark","Own the future of AI-powered automotive products

We‚Äôre looking for an AI Product Manager to turn cutting-edge machine learning into real business impact. At Indicata ‚Äì part of Autorola Group ‚Äì you‚Äôll lead the product journey for our Data Science & Engineering squad and bring our next-generation Dynamic Pricing Engine to life.
If you‚Äôre passionate about applied AI, product leadership, and building data-driven tools the market actually needs, this is your chance to make a real dent in the automotive industry.

Autorola Group is a global leader in online remarketing, automotive IT, and business intelligence solutions tailored for used vehicles and professional fleet management. Through our three business units ‚Äì Marketplace, Solutions, and Indicata ‚Äì we deliver innovative, digital tools that empower our clients to optimize every step of the vehicle lifecycle.

With more than 20 subsidiaries across Europe, Latin America, and Asia-Pacific, our platform connects OEMs, leasing companies, banks, and dealers, enabling seamless trade and data-driven decisions in real time.
In this role, you will join Indicata as our new AI Product Manager and bridge the gap between deep tech and commercial impact.

Indicata is the leading real-time analytics platform turning 14 million daily data points into smarter decisions for OEMs, dealer groups, and fleet owners. As part of the global Autorola Group, we help customers price better, sell faster, and optimize operations.

With the industry moving rapidly toward a data-first future, our AI-powered tools are more critical than ever. Already Europe‚Äôs most trusted used-car valuation engine, we‚Äôre now scaling intelligent pricing, stock-turn, and auction-strategy products into new markets.
We have world-class data scientists and a central AI Centre of Excellence - but we‚Äôve found the need to manage backlogs and herd stakeholders. That‚Äôs where you come in.

As AI Product Manager, you‚Äôll be the connective tissue between data, development, and the business. You‚Äôll act as Product Owner for our Data Science and Data Engineering squad, align closely with our Software Development POs, and use your Product Management skills to ensure that commercial opportunities turn into real, AI-powered product value.

This role blends strategic product thinking with a strong grasp of AI and stakeholder alignment. You‚Äôll drive the end-to-end process - from identifying opportunities to launching impactful machine learning features - while making sure we build what works, not just what‚Äôs possible. Therefore, your responsibilities will include:
Build AI-driven product features that enhance or expand our portfolio
Frame opportunities in terms of LLMs, fine-tuning, RAG, agents‚Äîor know when not to
Design and maintain an evaluation system for model quality, safety, and performance
Champion explainability, ethical AI, and bias checks to win trust with customers and regulators
Own and groom the backlog for the DS/DE squad
column2: set clear Product Goals

column1: Turn insights from sales, customers, and data into crisp stories and acceptance criteria
Facilitate agile rituals, align with other Product Owners, and report progress to C-level
Foster strong collaboration across AI, DEV, and commercial stakeholders
What success looks like in your first 12 months
Launch v1 of our ML‚Äëdriven Dynamic Pricing Engine in 5 pilot markets
Lift predictive accuracy by ‚â•10pp vs our current rule-based model
Reduce false-positive price suggestions by 30% via robust model evaluation
Establish a smooth sprint cadence with <5% open-defect rate at release
Build trusted relationships across AI, DEV, and commercial leadership
What you bring to the table
3-5 years in product management, with at least 2 years shipping AI/ML features
Product Owner experience in agile environments: backlog management, stakeholder alignment, sharp requirements
Conceptual understanding of ML: transformers, fine-tuning, XAI, retrieval pipelines
Hands-on data mindset‚Äîyou can explore notebooks and dashboards comfortably

column2: you bridge tech, business, and UX

column1: This is your chance to own AI products end-to-end in a global company with proven customers, rich datasets, and the budget to build. You‚Äôll work in a flat, outcome-focused culture‚Äîwhere ideas turn into prototypes quickly and user feedback is just a phone call away.

Our headquarters are located right by the train station at Skibhusvej 52A, 5000 Odense C, and we offer a good lunch arrangement, fitness room, pension scheme, health insurance, and social events (including a Friday bar to wrap up the week).

We‚Äôre looking to fill this position as soon as possible. If you‚Äôre excited by the mix of AI, product strategy, and hands-on execution, we‚Äôd love to hear from you‚Äîeven if you don‚Äôt tick every single box.
We review applications continuously and may close the posting once we‚Äôve found the right candidate.
For questions about the role, feel free to reach out to Christian Gless, Tech Talent Acquisition Partner, Autorola Group, at csg@autorola.com.

4251869123,https://dk.linkedin.com/jobs/view/global-head-of-aftersales-at-vitrolife-group-4251869123?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=%2BBj5YDEpdDdlMGa2OjF2Cw%3D%3D&trackingId=rLNxf9JNRNya7ITA4P7cyQ%3D%3D,Global Head of Aftersales,Vitrolife Group,"Viby, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark","At the Vitrolife Group, we work every day to unlock the full potential of science and technology to reduce the barriers towards building a family. Together we help our customers and their patients to fulfill the dream of having a baby.

Vitrolife Group is seeking a visionary and hands-on leader to shape the future of global Aftersales Services across our medtech and digital solutions portfolio. This role is your opportunity to unify and elevate a fragmented service landscape ‚Äî spanning medical devices, SaaS platforms, and EMR integrations ‚Äî into a world-class, customer-centric capability.
If you‚Äôre energized by complexity, passionate about continuous improvement, and driven to deliver value beyond the sale ‚Äî this is your moment to lead transformation at scale.

As Global Head of Aftersales, you will lead the strategic redesign and operational execution of our end-to-end service offering. You‚Äôll define how we install, support, and evolve mission-critical systems for fertility clinics and healthcare providers ‚Äî ensuring that service becomes a differentiator, not a cost center.

You will report to the SVP Consumables & Technologies and collaborate closely with global leaders across Sales, R&D, Quality, and Product to deliver seamless, value-added experiences for our customers worldwide.
Design and execute a unified global service strategy covering equipment installation, SaaS onboarding, and EMR data integration.
Define clear global-to-local workflows ‚Äî balancing cost, responsiveness, and regulatory needs.
Standardize operating models across business lines to improve transparency and accountability.
Consolidate tools into a unified service management platform ‚Äî enabling real-time SLA tracking, work order management, spare parts ordering, and customer dashboards.
Define and monitor KPIs such as customer satisfaction, mean time between failure, and integration success rates.
Embed lean practices and data-driven service improvements across regions.
Streamline all support touchpoints (chat, phone, portals) into a single, tiered helpdesk model.
Launch regular satisfaction surveys and feedback loops to identify friction points and drive enhancements.
Elevate service into a commercial asset by supporting renewal conversations and value-add offerings.
Structure and scale a high-performing global team: field engineers, tech support specialists, integration consultants, and regional managers.
Define role expectations, develop technical competencies, and cultivate a culture of accountability and continuous learning.
Channel field insights to R&D and Product teams to drive proactive roadmap improvements.
Partner with Sales and Marketing to deliver service performance data, support renewals, and identify upsell opportunities.
Lead budget planning and cost optimization across global service operations.
Identify synergies, automation opportunities, and operational efficiencies.
10+ years in global aftersales or service operations within high-tech or medtech environments.
Deep experience across hardware servicing, SaaS lifecycle support, and system integration.
Proven track record in building and scaling international teams with P&L responsibility.
Strong technical and analytical acumen ‚Äî confident working with service platforms, dashboards, and KPI frameworks.
A customer-first mindset ‚Äî with experience launching support models that improve satisfaction and retention.
Excellent collaboration, influence, and change leadership skills.
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business, or a related field.

column1: Vitrolife Group is a global provider of medical devices and genetic services. Based on science and advanced research capabilities, we develop services and products for personalised genetic information and medical device products. Vitrolife Group's products and services are available in more than 125 countries through our own presence in 25 countries and a network of distributors. 4265242560,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/associate-director-for-research-compliance-at-middlebury-college-4265242560?position=2&pageNum=5&refId=grPjspJQ%2Fqgej86PcXzw5Q%3D%3D&trackingId=Dd3Kg5iMQp2v5za3%2BmCaAQ%3D%3D,Associate Director for Research Compliance,Middlebury College,"Middlebury, VT","The Associate Director for Research Compliance oversees programs in the sciences related to environmental, health, and safety, supervising related staff and coordinating the administration and support for research compliance functions involving protection of human subjects, animal use, chemical and laboratory safety, and biological and radiation safety
column2: serves as Radiation Safety Officer.

column1: This is a full time, benefits eligible, salaried position with a hiring range of $88,197 - $112,493 per year.

Oversees and manages registrations with federal and state agencies, monitoring compliance with agency requirements, facilitating revisions to college policies and procedures, reporting problems or violations of agency requirements, and serving as Radiation Safety Officer.

Serves as the campus contact for information on state and federal regulations and best practices related to research compliance and the responsible conduct of research, identifying areas of compliance vulnerability, and performing risk assessments.
Oversees support to the college's compliance committees: Institutional Review Board (IRB), Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC), and Institutional Biosafety Committee (IBC)
column2: serves as IACUC Administrator.

column1: Provides guidance to students, faculty, and administrators on compliance committee requirements, to include assisting with protocol modifications necessary to obtain approval.

Manages compliance with institutional policies on Financial Conflict of Interest (FCOI) for grant-funded (sponsored) research and provides support to the Institutional Official responsible for Middlebury's Research Misconduct Policy.

Oversees animal programs, working closely with Institutional Official, IACUC chair and attending veterinarian to determine requirements and ensure full compliance with USDA, NIH-OLAW, AAALAC, and other regulations and standards applicable to animal care and welfare
column2: establishes related policies and procedures and manages the vivarium's occupational health and safety risk assessment program.

column1: Ensures that required training for students, staff, and faculty on safety and compliance-related issues is in place and is effective in support of responsible conduct of research by the Middlebury community.
Supervises staff members responsible for chemical, radiation, and other lab safety functions, research compliance, and greenhouse operations
A Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) and at least two years of experience working in a compliance area are required. Master's degree preferred.
Training appropriate for serving as Radiation Safety Officer.
Training on EPA and DOT requirements needed to be able to authorize or sign hazardous waste manifests.
Experience working in a human subject protection compliance or an animal program compliance position in a higher education setting is preferred
column2: prior experience working with research animals is an asset.

column1: The ability to express thoughts in a clear, concise, and professional manner, both verbally and in writing, to audiences with widely varying experience in working with compliance issues.
Excellent organizational skills, detail-oriented, and a strong work ethic with the ability to work both independently and effectively with students, other staff, faculty, and administrators
Work is performed in an office environment and requires the ability to operate standard office equipment and keyboards.
An offer for this position is contingent upon successful completion of a criminal background check and references.
As an employee of Middlebury College in Vermont or the Middlebury Institute in California, you will enjoy being part of a vibrant supportive community.

Middlebury offers its employees excellent compensation and competitive health, dental, life, disability, generous retirement matching, and vision benefits, and a generous time-away program - up to 34 days per year, increasing as the term of service lengthens. Employees are eligible for robust educational assistance programs. The result is a very high quality-of-life in a gorgeous setting. Middlebury Colleges offers its employees excellent compensation and other perks of employment including:

MiddCard Privileges: access to athletic facilities, discounts at the college store, library privileges, and cultural and sporting events. Spouses or domestic partners are eligible to receive a card with the same privileges
Discounts on season passes at Middlebury College's Snow Bowl, the Ralph Myhre Golf Course and the Rikert Outdoor Center
Access to our Partner Inclusion Program that provides comprehensive support services to the spouses and partners of Middlebury employees.
A full listing of our benefit offerings can be found on our website or click to see some of the other fun perks of working at Middlebury, whether in Middlebury, VT or Monterey, CA!

Middlebury College is an equal-opportunity employer where diversity, equity, and inclusion are core values. To this end, the College recruits talented and diverse faculty, staff, and students from across the United States and around the world. Middlebury College encourages applications from women, people of color, people with disabilities, and members of other protected classes and historically underrepresented communities. The College also invites applications from individuals who demonstrate an ongoing commitment to advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace.

The Associate Director for Research Compliance oversees programs in the sciences related to environmental, health, and safety, supervising related staff and coordinating the administration and support for research compliance functions involving protection of human subjects, animal use, chemical and laboratory safety, and biological and radiation safety
column2:
serves as Radiation Safety Officer.

This is a full time, benefits eligible, salaried position with a hiring range of $88,197 - $112,493 per year.

Core Responsibilities:

  • Oversees and manages registrations with federal and state agencies, monitoring compliance with agency requirements, facilitating revisions to college policies and procedures, reporting problems or violations of agency requirements, and serving as Radiation Safety Officer.
  • Serves as the campus contact for information on state and federal regulations and best practices related to research compliance and the responsible conduct of research, identifying areas of compliance vulnerability, and performing risk assessments.
  • Oversees support to the college's compliance committees: Institutional Review Board (IRB), Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC), and Institutional Biosafety Committee (IBC)
column3:
serves as IACUC Administrator.
  • Provides guidance to students, faculty, and administrators on compliance committee requirements, to include assisting with protocol modifications necessary to obtain approval.
  • Manages compliance with institutional policies on Financial Conflict of Interest (FCOI) for grant-funded (sponsored) research and provides support to the Institutional Official responsible for Middlebury's Research Misconduct Policy.
  • Oversees animal programs, working closely with Institutional Official, IACUC chair and attending veterinarian to determine requirements and ensure full compliance with USDA, NIH-OLAW, AAALAC, and other regulations and standards applicable to animal care and welfare
column4:
establishes related policies and procedures and manages the vivarium's occupational health and safety risk assessment program.
  • Ensures that required training for students, staff, and faculty on safety and compliance-related issues is in place and is effective in support of responsible conduct of research by the Middlebury community.
  • Supervises staff members responsible for chemical, radiation, and other lab safety functions, research compliance, and greenhouse operations

    • Requirements

    • A Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) and at least two years of experience working in a compliance area are required. Master's degree preferred.
    • Training appropriate for serving as Radiation Safety Officer.
    • Training on EPA and DOT requirements needed to be able to authorize or sign hazardous waste manifests.
    • Experience working in a human subject protection compliance or an animal program compliance position in a higher education setting is preferred
column5:
prior experience working with research animals is an asset.
  • The ability to express thoughts in a clear, concise, and professional manner, both verbally and in writing, to audiences with widely varying experience in working with compliance issues.
  • Excellent organizational skills, detail-oriented, and a strong work ethic with the ability to work both independently and effectively with students, other staff, faculty, and administrators

    • Physical Demands and Working Conditions:

    Work is performed in an office environment and requires the ability to operate standard office equipment and keyboards.

    Other:

    An offer for this position is contingent upon successful completion of a criminal background check and references.

    Benefits

    As an employee of Middlebury College in Vermont or the Middlebury Institute in California, you will enjoy being part of a vibrant supportive community.

    Middlebury offers its employees excellent compensation and competitive health, dental, life, disability, generous retirement matching, and vision benefits, and a generous time-away program - up to 34 days per year, increasing as the term of service lengthens. Employees are eligible for robust educational assistance programs. The result is a very high quality-of-life in a gorgeous setting. Middlebury Colleges offers its employees excellent compensation and other perks of employment including:

    • MiddCard Privileges: access to athletic facilities, discounts at the college store, library privileges, and cultural and sporting events. Spouses or domestic partners are eligible to receive a card with the same privileges
    • Discounts on season passes at Middlebury College's Snow Bowl, the Ralph Myhre Golf Course and the Rikert Outdoor Center
    • Access to our Partner Inclusion Program that provides comprehensive support services to the spouses and partners of Middlebury employees.
    • A full listing of our benefit offerings can be found on our website or click to see some of the other fun perks of working at Middlebury, whether in Middlebury, VT or Monterey, CA!

    Middlebury College is an equal-opportunity employer where diversity, equity, and inclusion are core values. To this end, the College recruits talented and diverse faculty, staff, and students from across the United States and around the world. Middlebury College encourages applications from women, people of color, people with disabilities, and members of other protected classes and historically underrepresented communities. The College also invites applications from individuals who demonstrate an ongoing commitment to advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace.

KPH Healthcare Services, Inc. is a multistate organization and abides by all local, state and federal regulations as it pertains to minimum wage requirements.

Overview

Job Summary: Assist pharmacy staff in the triaging of incoming prescriptions, the delivery of filled prescriptions to the patients, and all cashier duties. Works under direct supervision of a pharmacist and follows standard procedures to accomplish assigned tasks

Responsibilities

Job Duties:

  • Assist in the Triaging of incoming prescriptions
  • Verify and gather necessary patient information including name, address, phone number, date of birth, allergies, chronic conditions, request for non-safety caps and insurance information
  • Assess the workload, establish the prescription pick up time and queue the prescription for processing
  • Assist in the delivery of prescriptions to the patient, including obtaining patient signatures
  • Performing cash register duties within the Pharmacy Department
  • Provide quality customer service to all customers
  • Perform housekeeping duties necessary to maintain a professional environment, including replenishment of necessary vials and dispensing containers, labels and computer paper supplies
  • Maintain confidentiality regarding all patient information
  • Must keep current with all State and Federal requirements as related to conditions of employment
  • Perform all store clerk duties as needed
  • Responsible for completing all mandatory and regulatory training programs
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications

Educational Requirements:

  • Minimum: High School Diploma (or currently enrolled) or GED
  • Preferred: AS Degree or Higher Required

Vermont Employees

Registered with the State of Vermont as a Pharmacy Technician Experience:

Preferred: Hospital or retail pharmacy experience

Special Conditions of Employment

  • Drug test
  • Initial and continuous exclusion and sanction/disciplinary monitoring
  • Any and all additional eligibility requirements based on the specific position

Compensation

$15.50 - 16.00 an hour

The final offer will be determined after careful consideration of multiple factors such as relevant skills, years of experience and education.√Ç

Sugarbush Resort is a year-round destination offering some of the best skiing and riding in the east, an award-winning ski school, golf, disc golf, an array of dining venues, and a fully appointed Health and Recreation Center. Do you want to join an all-star team dedicated to delivering an unparalleled guest experience? Make this your best winter yet by joining the team at Sugarbush and taking advantage of everything Vermont has to offer.
BESIDES GETTING PAID TO WORK AT AN INCREDIBLE RESORT, WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?:
Free skiing + riding privileges at Sugarbush and across the family of Alterra Mountain Company resorts for all eligible employees and their dependents.
Golf perks along with health & recreation center membership for eligible employees and their dependents.
Vacation and sick time for eligible employees to rest, relax and recharge.
Generous discounts on food & beverage, apparel, and outdoor gear.
Medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D, short term & long-term disability insurance, EAP, HSAs, FSAs, and more.
Paid parental leave of up to 6 weeks for eligible employees.
Sugarbush Resort is hiring a Full-time Year-round Contact Center Manager. The pay range is between $68,000-$75,000 depending on experience.

The Contact Center Manager will support and oversee operations of the Sugarbush Call Center through maintaining and monitoring staffing levels appropriate to call volume and department demands. They will hire, train, schedule, motivate staff, and monitor customer service skills and productivity to maximize profit for the resort and guest satisfaction and maintain company performance metrics.

Manage the duties of the Supervisor and reservations staff to insure the efficient and quality results of reservations team, to include guest satisfaction, sales professionalism, and revenue generation.

Maintain a complete knowledge of all resort facilities, room types and amenities and remain up to date on all rates and stay restrictions, promotions and campaigns, and changes in policies and procedures.
Ensure regular coaching, training and learning opportunities for associates, daily, weekly, and monthly, as needed and supporting HR training models.
Attend all designated meetings, as assigned.
Identify reporting requirements and metrics to create, manage and execute lodging budget.
Provide feedback to Revenue Optimization Team to better maximize resorts revenue and marketing capabilities.
